Title: Senior BI Analyst
Description:
Bring your flavor

Building the future of food and well-being starts with you. Join our team and bring your best self to the table.

#bringyourflavor




What You Will Be Doing

The Own Brands Strategic Sourcing Department has an opening for a Senior BI Analyst.

The BI Analyst is responsible for delivering business solutions that collect, transform, analyze, and interpret data to draw key insights to support Strategic Sourcing in making an informed data-based and strategic decisions on category review and negotiations. Has a keen ability to extract data from a variety of sources across the Albertsons enterprise and use quantitative skill set to create dashboards, reports, metrics using a variety of business intelligence tools, techniques, and technology. This individual must have a unique combination of technical and business operations acumen and experience, coupled with strong emotional intelligence.




The position will be based in Boise, Idaho, or one of our main regional offices (Seattle, WA, Portland, OR, Pleasanton CA, Denver CO, Dallas TX, Chicago, IL, or Fullerton, CA, Phoenix, AZ).




Main Responsibilities

Partner with Own Brands Strategic Sourcing Team with business needs and provide solutions for data insights.
Analyze large and complex data sets and create optimized solutions to present actionable recommendations to Sourcing Managers.
Ability to take data with different ranges of complexity level from disparate sources across the enterprise and synthesize into meaningful business insights for Sourcing Managers.
Provide in-depth analytical support for a variety of sourcing initiatives including category reviews, new item cost analysis, and logistic assessments.
Aggregate data from RFI/RFP submissions and help create a decision matrix.
Prepare and present analytics results and recommendations to leaders by building visual charts, graphs, and process flows.
Create ad-hoc customized reports for a variety of needs/functions through platforms such as Power BI dashboard.
Lead creating training content for Strategic Sourcing Team such as excel tips and tricks.
Mentor BI Analysts.




The salary range is $82,900 to $115,000 annually. Starting salary will vary based on criteria such as location, experience, and qualifications. There may be flexibility for exceptional candidates.




What We Are Searching For

Preferred degree in: Business, Accounting, Supply Chain, Finance or equivalent. MBA preferred.
3- 5 years experience and /or the education listed above.
3+ years in business analytics and retail or backstage/corporate experience.
Knowledge in formal strategic sourcing processes and methodologies.
Excellent understanding of manufacturing, distribution and logistics.
Advanced ability to strategically plan data architecture and information needed to ensure relevant information is accessible.
Experience with Business intelligence visualization process Power BI or equivalent to create impactful reports and interactive dashboards
Ability to multi-task and manage a variety of business programs/initiatives in response to changing priorities
Ability to explain complicated or technical information in a streamlined manner to non-technical audiences
Strong analytical, quantitative, and problem-solving skills
Advanced computer skills including SQL, VBA, Excel, and PowerPoint. Ability to understand and work with multiple enterprise wide systems.
Experience pulling information or modifying/creating queries from database such as Snowflake, SSIMS and EDM.
Excellent oral, written and presentation communication skills.
Excellent relationship building and collaboration skills
High energy level and sense of urgency on executing initiatives.

What is it like at Albertsons?

Our 290,000 associates have a passion for great service and building lasting relationships with our customers. Through a companywide focus on innovation, we are continually enhancing our digital and product offerings, making it easy for customers to get what they need, wherever they are.

Albertsons is an Equal Opportunity Employer

This Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, gender, ethnicity, religion, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, or on any other basis prohibited by law. Consistent with applicable state and local law, the Company will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

We endeavor to make this site accessible to any and all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact us at 1-888-255-2269(option #4).

Title: Lead Data Analyst
Description:
We're looking for a Lead Data Analyst to join Navan, Inc.'s global Data team. You'll work with stakeholders from across the business, including finance, commerce, engineering, sales, and operations, to define data needs and products that drive the company forward. We need someone with exceptional data skills and a business mindset who can manage multiple moving pieces and deliver value to customers.

What You’ll Do


Lead cross-functional collaborations with Finance, Engineering, Sales, and Operations to deliver data-driven solutions and strategic insights.
Manage and mentor a team of data analysts, ensuring high-quality reporting and analysis.
Partner with financial stakeholders to build and refine financial models for strategic planning.
Oversee the creation of operational and financial reports, presenting insights to senior management.
Drive self-service analytics by developing training programs for BI tools (e.g., Tableau).
Consolidate data across units and acquisitions, ensuring consistency in definitions and reporting standards.
Lead process improvements for reporting and analytics efficiency, optimizing tools and methodologies.
Support ad-hoc requests, focusing on financial reconciliations and complex reporting needs.
Provide actionable insights on financial performance to guide key business decisions.


What We’re Looking For


8+ years in Data Analysis, with 5+ years in a leadership role.
Expertise in SQL, Tableau, and financial reporting.
Strong leadership skills with a track record of mentoring and guiding teams.
Advanced knowledge of statistical techniques and financial analysis.
Proven ability to work with large datasets and ensure reporting accuracy.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex insights to diverse audiences.
Experience with process automation and driving efficiency across data operations.


The posted pay range represents the anticipated low and high end of the compensation for this position and is subject to change based on business need. To determine a successful candidate’s starting pay, we carefully consider a variety of factors, including primary work location, an evaluation of the candidate’s skills and experience, market demands, and internal parity.For roles with on-target-earnings (OTE), the pay range includes both base salary and target incentive compensation. Target incentive compensation for some roles may include a ramping draw period. Compensation is higher for those who exceed targets. Candidates may receive more information from the recruiter.

Pay Range: $142,500 USD - $261,000 USD

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
About ServiceUp

We’re revolutionizing the entire car repair experience by saving businesses, consumers, and shops from an outdated repair ecosystem. Our tech-driven repair platform automates the entire repair process, resulting in saved time and costs while eliminating hassle.

We pride ourselves on delivering cutting-edge solutions that empower businesses to thrive in today's digital landscape. With a commitment to excellence and a passion for innovation, we are dedicated to driving success for our clients and fostering a collaborative and rewarding work environment.

About The Role

We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our team at ServiceUp. The ideal candidate will turn complex data into actionable insights that drive business decisions. This role requires a combination of analytical prowess, technical skills, and the ability to communicate findings effectively to various stakeholders across the organization.

A Data Analyst will have the following responsibilities

Analyze datasets from multiple sources to identify trends, patterns, and KPIs

Create user friendly reports and dashboards to track business metrics and share with stakeholders

Build and maintain SQL data models to support business decision-making processes and operational reporting

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and provide analytical support

Develop and implement data quality processes to ensure accuracy and reliability

Partner with engineering on event data collection procedures and identify opportunities for process improvement

Translate findings into clear, actionable insights for non-technical audiences

Train teams on report and dashboard usage and best practices

An excellent candidate will exhibit the following

Required

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field

2+ years of experience in data analysis or related role

High proficiency with SQL

Strong skills with Excel, Google Sheets, and data visualization tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau, Power BI)

Excellent problem-solving abilities and attention to detail

Strong communication skills and ability to present complex data in an understandable way

Preferred

Experience with BigQuery and Looker

Experience with a programming language such as Python or R for scripting and ad hoc data analysis

Experience in the automotive or service industry

Familiarity with A/B testing methodologies

We believe that shared values are fundamental to a successful and fulfilling professional journey. Before applying, we encourage you to familiarize yourself with our company's values, mission, and culture. Understanding how your values align with ours will ensure a mutually rewarding and harmonious work experience.

Visit our website https://serviceup.com/about-us to learn more about who we are and what we stand for.

Please take the time to read and understand them as they define who we are and what we look for in our candidates

______

ServiceUp is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status.

This role requires a combination of analytical prowess, technical skills, and the ability to communicate findings effectively to various stakeholders across the organization.

A Data Analyst will have the following responsibilities

Analyze datasets from multiple sources to identify trends, patterns, and KPIs

Create user friendly reports and dashboards to track business metrics and share with stakeholders

Build and maintain SQL data models to support business decision-making processes and operational reporting

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and provide analytical support

Develop and implement data quality processes to ensure accuracy and reliability

Partner with engineering on event data collection procedures and identify opportunities for process improvement

Translate findings into clear, actionable insights for non-technical audiences

Train teams on report and dashboard usage and best practices

An excellent candidate will exhibit the following

Required

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field

2+ years of experience in data analysis or related role

High proficiency with SQL

Strong skills with Excel, Google Sheets, and data visualization tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau, Power BI)

Excellent problem-solving abilities and attention to detail

Strong communication skills and ability to present complex data in an understandable way

Preferred

Experience with BigQuery and Looker

Experience with a programming language such as Python or R for scripting and ad hoc data analysis

Experience in the automotive or service industry

Familiarity with A/B testing methodologies

We believe that shared values are fundamental to a successful and fulfilling professional journey. Before applying, we encourage you to familiarize yourself with our company's values, mission, and culture. Understanding how your values align with ours will ensure a mutually rewarding and harmonious work experience.

Visit our website https://serviceup.com/about-us to learn more about who we are and what we stand for.

Please take the time to read and understand them as they define who we are and what we look for in our candidates

______

ServiceUp is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status.

Title: Data Annotation Specialist
Description:
About Us

At Hayden AI, we are on a mission to harness the power of artificial intelligence and machine learning to transform the way governments and businesses address real-world challenges.

From optimizing bus lane and bus stop enforcement to pioneering digital twin modeling and beyond, our innovative mobile perception system empowers our clients to accelerate transit, enhance street safety, and drive forward a sustainable future.

What The Job Involves

Hayden AI is looking for a meticulous and detail-oriented Data Annotation Specialist to join our team. As a Data Annotation Specialist, you will be responsible for overseeing the quality assurance and annotation process of datasets, ensuring accuracy and consistency. You will work closely with our internal teams to maintain high standards of data integrity and facilitate the smooth execution of data-related projects. The ideal candidate has a strong analytical mindset, excellent communication skills, and a keen eye for identifying patterns and anomalies in the data pipeline.

Responsibilities


Primary focus is contributing to our route configuration and annotation process, ensuring adherence to quality standards and project requirements.
Review and evaluate data sets for accuracy, completeness, and consistency, identifying and resolving discrepancies or errors.
Develop and implement guidelines, protocols, and standard operating procedures for annotation activities.
Assist with training annotators, providing guidance, feedback, and support to ensure consistent and accurate results.
Monitor and track progress of annotation tasks, ensuring timelines are met and project goals are achieved.
Conduct regular quality control checks on annotated data, implementing corrective measures as needed.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to address data-related issues, provide insights, and contribute to process improvements.
Assist in data analysis and reporting tasks as needed, providing insights and recommendations based on the reviewed/annotated data.


Requirements


Excellent attention to detail, with a high degree of accuracy in reviewing and annotating data.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
Training experience
Ability to prioritize tasks, meet deadlines, and adapt to changing project requirements.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to provide actionable insights based on data analysis.
Knowledge of machine learning concepts and experience with data labeling for machine learning models is a plus.
Proficiency in using spreadsheet tools (Excel, Google Sheets).


Benefits And Perks

There are endless learning and development opportunities from a highly diverse and talented peer group, including experts in a wide range of fields (AI, Computer Vision, Government Contracting, Systems & Device Engineering, Operations, Communications, and more!)


Options for medical, dental, and vision coverage for employees and dependents (for US employees)
Flexible Spending Account (FSA) and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account (DCFSA)
401(k) with 3% company matching
Unlimited PTO
Daily catered lunches in our San Francisco office


At Hayden AI, we are committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workplace where everyone is treated with respect and dignity. We believe that our differences make us stronger and drive innovation. As an equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate against any employee or applicant based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status. We are dedicated to fostering a work environment that celebrates diversity and ensures that every individual has the opportunity to contribute to our mission and achieve their full potential.

Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Hayden AI employees or any other company location. Hayden AI is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Compensation Range: $79K - $92.9K


Show more

Title: Data Analyst III
Description:
Title: Data Analyst III

Location: Remote (Preferred Timezone: PST)

Duration: 12 months (Potential Extension)

Compensation: $56-76/hr

Work Requirements: US Citizen, GC Holders, or Authorized to Work in the U.S.

Skillset / Experience:

About the Role

As an Analytics Engineer, you will be part of a global team dedicated to leveraging customer feedback and insights to drive business improvements. Your expertise in creating data pipelines and interactive self-service dashboards will provide critical visibility into key business metrics. Additionally, you will contribute to data governance policies, data quality standards, and best practices for data visualization to ensure the accuracy, reliability, and usability of our data assets.

We are looking for a candidate with a strong technical background and a deep understanding of customer experience analytics, specifically in customer support and operations. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced environment, manages multiple projects simultaneously, and has excellent organizational and presentation skills. The ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and build strong relationships with stakeholders is essential.

Responsibilities:

Design, develop, integrate, and maintain data pipelines, queries, reports, and visualizations to support multiple business use cases.
Create interactive and dynamic dashboards to communicate complex insights to stakeholders.
Optimize pipelines, dashboards, and data architecture for efficient data development and analysis.
Work closely with customer service, operations, product, and engineering teams to integrate data-driven insights into business decisions.
Utilize various data sources, including customer interactions, feedback, and behavioral data, to identify pain points and trends.
Develop and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the effectiveness of customer experience initiatives.
Contribute to the development of data governance policies and quality standards to ensure data accuracy and reliability.
Define best practices for data visualization that facilitate actionable insights.

Minimum Qualifications:

Master’s degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in data engineering, business intelligence, or data analytics.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL.
Experience in building data pipelines and ETL processes using platforms like Apache Airflow or AWS Glue.
Strong expertise in creating interactive dashboards using Tableau, Power BI, or similar tools.
Ability to manage time-sensitive projects while balancing multiple stakeholders and evolving priorities.
Experience working in customer service, customer experience, or supply chain operations.
Preferred Qualifications:Background in Customer Experience (CX) and Voice of the Customer (VoC) analytics.
Familiarity with customer support software such as Salesforce.
Experience with digital analytics tools like Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics.
Knowledge of agile development methodologies and version control systems such as Git.
Experience in the high-volume consumer electronics industry.

Must-Have Skills:

Programming Skills (Python): Proficiency in Python, including libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, and Matplotlib.
Data Engineering (SQL & Data Pipelines): Experience in SQL and building data pipelines/ETL processes using tools like Apache Airflow or AWS Glue.
Customer Experience Analytics: Understanding of customer experience principles, including analyzing and interpreting customer feedback and behavioral data.
Data Visualization: Experience working with metrics and building interactive dashboards using Tableau, Power BI, or similar tools.

Nice-to-Have Skills:

Experience with digital analytics tools such as Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics.
Knowledge of agile development methodologies and version control systems like Git.
Familiarity with Salesforce and customer support analytics.
Day-to-Day Responsibilities:
Develop and maintain scalable data pipelines for real-time insights.
Design and deploy self-service dashboards to empower stakeholders with actionable insights.
Establish data quality standards to ensure data integrity and reliability.
Define best practices for data visualization to facilitate informed decision-making.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to enhance customer experience analytics.

Evaluation Metrics:

Ability to analyze and interpret complex data sets to inform business decisions.
Development and maintenance of robust data pipelines and analytics tools.
Collaboration with cross-functional teams to optimize customer experience.
Delivery of actionable insights and recommendations to leadership.
Application of data science and statistical expertise to enhance customer analytics.

Our benefits package includes:

Comprehensive medical benefits

Competitive pay

401(k) retirement plan

…and much more!

About INSPYR SolutionsTechnology is our focus, and quality is our commitment. As a national expert in delivering flexible technology and talent solutions, we align industry and technical expertise with our clients’ business objectives. Our tailored solutions include professional services, project support, and talent placement. By prioritizing excellence and the human aspect of our business, we connect top talent with the right opportunities. Learn more at inspyrsolutions.com.

INSPYR Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or genetics. We comply with applicable federal, state, and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment.

Title: Technical Data Analyst II
Description:
Responsibilities

Kforce has a client that is seeking a Technical Data Analyst II in Mountain View, CA. Responsibilities:


Technical Data Analyst II will collect data in the domain of Product, Sales, Web, etc. to construct data pipeline for feature store
Iterate machine learning experimentations to build the most optimized models
Build dashboard to organize and unpack insights for stakeholders


Requirements


Bachelor's degree in Information Systems, or Computer Science, Engineering, Applied Math or equivalent work experience
2-4 years of experience preferred; Entry level with solid SQL, Python and ML skills are also welcomed
Experience in statistical modeling techniques such as clustering, classification, regression, decision trees, neural nets, support vector machines, NLP text mining and LLM
Technical proficiency in SQL, Databrick, Tableau, and Qlik Sense
Can-do attitude, hands-on approach, passionate about data


The pay range is the lowest to highest compensation we reasonably in good faith believe we would pay at posting for this role. We may ultimately pay more or less than this range. Employee pay is based on factors like relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, location, performance, union contract and business needs. This range may be modified in the future.

We offer comprehensive benefits including medical/dental/vision insurance, HSA, FSA, 401(k), and life, disability & ADD insurance to eligible employees. Salaried personnel receive paid time off. Hourly employees are not eligible for paid time off unless required by law. Hourly employees on a Service Contract Act project are eligible for paid sick leave.

Note: Pay is not considered compensation until it is earned, vested and determinable. The amount and availability of any compensation remains in Kforce's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified in its discretion consistent with the law.

This job is not eligible for bonuses, incentives or commissions.

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

By clicking “Apply Today” you agree to receive calls, AI-generated calls, text messages or emails from Kforce and its affiliates, and service providers. Note that if you choose to communicate with Kforce via text messaging the frequency may vary, and message and data rates may apply. Carriers are not liable for delayed or undelivered messages. You will always have the right to cease communicating via text by using key words such as STOP.

Title: Analytics Lead, Lever Insights
Description:
At Lyft, our mission is to improve people’s lives with the world’s best transportation. To do this, we start with our own community by creating an open, inclusive, and diverse organization.

Data and analytics are at the heart of Lyft’s products and decision-making. The Central Market Management team works in a dynamic environment, where we embrace moving quickly to build the world’s best transportation.

Within Central Market Management, an Analytics Lead on the Decision & Insights team will take on a variety of problems ranging from long term business strategic decisions to weekly agile marketplace operations. We’re looking for a passionate Analytics Lead to take on some of the most interesting and impactful problems in ridesharing. You will work closely on Rider or Driver Acquisition initiatives to help run the marketplace more efficiently. This is fundamental to the Lyft marketplace as these initiatives help us communicate effectively with riders and drivers, enhance their experience and maintain balance in our marketplace. The ideal candidate has deep analytical skills, exceptional problem solving skills, and is comfortable working with a highly cross functional team.

Responsibilities:


Manage and improve Rider and Driver Acquisition investment processes to run the marketplace more efficiently
Partner with Data Science, Product, Engineering, P&L Management and other cross-functional stakeholders to achieve business goals
Leverage analytics to understand critical business problems and recommend action plans
Develop frameworks, roadmaps, and metrics for the team and broader organization
Collaborate with other leaders and executives to build data-informed business strategies and roadmaps


Experience:


Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Math, Economics, Analytics, Finance, Business or other related quantitative field
3-5 years experience in consulting, analytics, technology, strategic finance, or start-up operations
Strong ability in building decision making frameworks and data analysis, able to dissect business issues, analyze large amounts of data, and draw actionable conclusions
Very strong attention to detail, experience developing processes to implement strategy
Ability to think strategically about complex and unstructured business problems, leading to recommendations and action plans
Strong written and verbal communication skills for internal stakeholders, including senior leadership
Ability to effectively and independently build and maintain cross-functional relationships with stakeholders, manage multiple competing priorities, and drive projects to completion
Experience with a two-sided marketplace is especially desirable
Highly proficient in SQL and Excel/Google Sheets; Proficiency in Python is a plus
Entrepreneurial self-starter - you naturally take ownership, look for opportunities, and do whatever it takes to drive results


Benefits:


Great medical, dental, and vision insurance options with additional programs available when enrolled
Mental health benefits
Family building benefits
Child care and pet benefits
401(k) plan to help save for your future
In addition to 12 observed holidays, salaried team members have discretionary paid time off, hourly team members have 15 days paid time off
18 weeks of paid parental leave. Biological, adoptive, and foster parents are all eligible
Subsidized commuter benefits
Lyft Pink - Lyft team members get an exclusive opportunity to test new benefits of our Ridership Program


Lyft is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer committed to an inclusive and diverse workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other basis prohibited by law. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

This role will be in-office on a hybrid schedule — Team Members will be expected to work in the office 3 days per week on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays. Additionally, hybrid roles have the flexibility to work from anywhere for up to 4 weeks per year. #Hybrid

The expected base pay range for this position in the San Francisco area is $118,000 - $147,500. Salary ranges are dependent on a variety of factors, including qualifications, experience and geographic location. Range is not inclusive of potential equity offering, bonus or benefits. Your recruiter can share more information about the salary range specific to your working location and other factors during the hiring process.
Show more

Title: Data Analytics & Insights Intern
Description:
Description

DATA ANALYTICS & INSIGHTS INTERN

About

Common Sense is a nonprofit organization that gives kids, families, and schools the tools to make informed choices about media and technology. Families know us for our independent, age-based reviews of movies, TV shows, books, games, podcasts, and apps. Educators use our free curriculum and edtech reviews to plan lessons and integrate technology into their teaching practice. At our core, we are a children's advocacy group. We draw on original research, industry expertise, and community partnerships to advocate for laws and policies that help kids thrive.

We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunities to thrive. We hire and cultivate diverse teams of the best and brightest from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We offer a hybrid work model that combines in-office work and remote work opportunities, balancing operational effectiveness and collaboration.

SCOPE

The Data Analytics & Insights Intern will analyze data and generate insights to support decision-making across product and key stakeholder groups such as marketing and business development. This internship is ideal for someone who enjoys working with data, uncovering trends, and translating numbers into meaningful stories.

Responsibilities


Data Collection & Preparation
Gather and clean data from multiple sources, ensuring accuracy and consistency.
Use SQL to query and transform large datasets for analysis.
Organize and document data sources to improve accessibility and reproducibility.
Data Analysis & Insights Generation
Analyze user data across multiple platforms to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for improvement.
Support cross-functional teams with data-driven decision-making.
Conduct exploratory data analysis (EDA) to uncover hidden patterns and correlations.
Reporting & Visualization
Develop dashboards and reports using Tableau, Looker, or Google Data Studio.
Present insights through clear and compelling data visualizations.
Automate reporting processes to streamline access to key metrics.
Experimentation & Performance Measurement
Assist in A/B testing efforts and other experimentation methods.
Measure the impact of product changes and optimizations using statistical analysis.
Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs).


QUALIFICATIONS


SQL proficiency (querying, filtering, aggregating, and joining data).
Experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, Looker, etc.).
Strong analytical thinking and ability to translate data into actionable insights.
Python for data manipulation (a plus, but not required).
Understanding of A/B testing principles and basic statistical analysis.
Ability to work collaboratively with technical and non-technical teams.
Curiosity, attention to detail, and a passion for working with data.


Additional Information


REPORTS TO: Senior Director, Data & Technology
LOCATION: San Francisco, CA
DURATION: June 16 - August 22, 2025
PAY : $25/hr, up to 40 hours/week This is a paid opportunity, and we will work with your clinical or internship office for school credit if necessary.
Interns must be available to attend weekly educational Lunch & Learns, which are held every Wednesday from 12 p.m. to 1 p.m. (PST).


Common Sense provides equal employment opportunities to all qualified individuals and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, pregnancy, age, national origin, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, genetic information, or any other protected classification or characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.

Common Sense will also consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. However, job offers are made on the condition that the applicant subsequently passes a criminal background check. If the background check indicates a prior criminal conviction, we will conduct an individualized assessment to determine whether the conviction should result in denial of employment. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider employment for qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

HTML:
Description

 DATA ANALYTICS & INSIGHTS INTERN

About

Common Sense is a nonprofit organization that gives kids, families, and schools the tools to make informed choices about media and technology. Families know us for our independent, age-based reviews of movies, TV shows, books, games, podcasts, and apps. Educators use our free curriculum and edtech reviews to plan lessons and integrate technology into their teaching practice. At our core, we are a children's advocacy group. We draw on original research, industry expertise, and community partnerships to advocate for laws and policies that help kids thrive.

We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunities to thrive. We hire and cultivate diverse teams of the best and brightest from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We offer a hybrid work model that combines in-office work and remote work opportunities, balancing operational effectiveness and collaboration.

SCOPE

The Data Analytics & Insights Intern will analyze data and generate insights to support decision-making across product and key stakeholder groups such as marketing and business development. This internship is ideal for someone who enjoys working with data, uncovering trends, and translating numbers into meaningful stories.

Responsibilities

  • Data Collection & Preparation
  • Gather and clean data from multiple sources, ensuring accuracy and consistency.
  • Use SQL to query and transform large datasets for analysis.
  • Organize and document data sources to improve accessibility and reproducibility.
  • Data Analysis & Insights Generation
  • Analyze user data across multiple platforms to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for improvement.
  • Support cross-functional teams with data-driven decision-making.
  • Conduct exploratory data analysis (EDA) to uncover hidden patterns and correlations.
  • Reporting & Visualization
  • Develop dashboards and reports using Tableau, Looker, or Google Data Studio.
  • Present insights through clear and compelling data visualizations.
  • Automate reporting processes to streamline access to key metrics.
  • Experimentation & Performance Measurement
  • Assist in A/B testing efforts and other experimentation methods.
  • Measure the impact of product changes and optimizations using statistical analysis.
  • Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs).

QUALIFICATIONS

  • SQL proficiency (querying, filtering, aggregating, and joining data).
  • Experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, Looker, etc.).
  • Strong analytical thinking and ability to translate data into actionable insights.
  • Python for data manipulation (a plus, but not required).
  • Understanding of A/B testing principles and basic statistical analysis.
  • Ability to work collaboratively with technical and non-technical teams.
  • Curiosity, attention to detail, and a passion for working with data.

Additional Information

  • REPORTS TO: Senior Director, Data & Technology
  • LOCATION: San Francisco, CA
  • DURATION: June 16 - August 22, 2025
  • PAY : $25/hr, up to 40 hours/week This is a paid opportunity, and we will work with your clinical or internship office for school credit if necessary.
  • Interns must be available to attend weekly educational Lunch & Learns, which are held every Wednesday from 12 p.m. to 1 p.m. (PST).

Common Sense provides equal employment opportunities to all qualified individuals and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, pregnancy, age, national origin, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, genetic information, or any other protected classification or characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.

Common Sense will also consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. However, job offers are made on the condition that the applicant subsequently passes a criminal background check. If the background check indicates a prior criminal conviction, we will conduct an individualized assessment to determine whether the conviction should result in denial of employment. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider employment for qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Title: Data Analyst, Product & Regulatory Ops
Description:
Product & Regulatory Operations (PRO) plays a critical role in product development and legal compliance at Meta. They provide data and insights to build and improve products, like Facebook, Instagram, and Reality Labs.As a horizontal analytics team, Product & Regulatory Operations Analytics enables teams across PRO to make data-informed decisions by serving as analytics thought-partners to solve operational business problems. We build foundational data products and employ a diverse toolkit of analytical approaches to guide decision making.In this role, you won’t simply present data, but tell data-driven stories and share actionable insights. You will advise operations and systems using clear insights and recommendations, develop data-driven investment strategies to optimize product outcomes, and collaborate with a diverse set of cross-functional partners to identify, quantify, and solve PRO’s biggest challenges.This work utilizes one of the largest data sets in the world and drives high-stakes outcomes that impact billions of people on and off the platform. By joining Meta, you will become part of a world-class analytics community dedicated to skill development and career growth in analytics and beyond.

Data Analyst, Product & Regulatory Ops Responsibilities:


Identify metric trends and insights for business reviews to provide leadership visibility into operational health and performance against desired outcomes
Translate business objectives into actionable analyses, clearly communicating technical concepts and operational implications to varied audiences
Develop scalable analytics solutions that provide the essential insights needed to support agile decision making
Apply quantitative skills and incorporate qualitative insights to inform and advise strategy for Product Delivery Operations
Partner with Operations, Data Science, Data Engineering, Systems, and Engineering teams to identify and execute against opportunities that increase operational efficiency and effectiveness
Drive forecasting, scenario planning, and predictive analytics to optimize our operational expenditures


Minimum Qualifications:


B.A./B.S. degree with a quantitative focus in Economics, Computer Science, Information Systems, Math, Statistics, or a similar technical field
3+ years of work experience in an analytics or consulting role involving strategy, problem solving, and/or technical systems
Experience working in a fast-paced, rapidly-changing environment, while managing multiple priorities and stakeholders
Experience communicating effectively to technical and non-technical audiences
Experience in communication with management
Experience using analytics to break down ambiguous, complex problems using data
Experience with data querying languages (e.g. SQL) and experience with scripting languages (e.g. Python)


Preferred Qualifications:


Experience developing data pipelines via SQL and Python-based ETL frameworks
Advanced degree with a quantitative focus (Computer Science, Statistics, Finance, Information Systems, Applied Economics or similar technical field) or equivalent practical experience
Experience working in an operations organization


About Meta:

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Meta participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. Please note that Meta may leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies in connection with applications for employment.

Meta is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

$104,000/year to $146,000/year + bonus + equity + benefits

Individual compensation is determined by skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Compensation details listed in this posting reflect the base hourly rate, monthly rate, or annual salary only, and do not include bonus, equity or sales incentives, if applicable. In addition to base compensation, Meta offers benefits. Learn more about benefits at Meta.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (F/H)
Description:
Nous recherchons un Data Analyst, pour un CDD de 12 mois, passionné par les données et les outils de visualisation pour rejoindre notre équipe. Le candidat idéal aura une connaissance approfondie de Power BI et sera capable de travailler en étroite collaboration avec nos Business Analysts pour les aider à constituer leurs propres jeux de données et tableaux de bord.

Ce poste nécessite une forte capacité d'écoute et une aptitude à partager ses connaissances de manière pédagogique.


Savencia est un groupe alimentaire international, familial et indépendant, imprégné de valeurs d'entreprise fortes et d'une vocation : " Entreprendre pour mieux nourrir l'homme ". Avec plus de 23.000 employés dans 34 pays, Savencia développe des produits innovants de haute qualité qui sont principalement commercialisés dans la distribution et la restauration.

Savencia croit fermement en l'égalité professionnelle entre les femmes et les hommes et à la combinaison de la parentalité avec les ambitions professionnelles de chacun. Cet engagement, inscrit dans sa feuille de route « Vers un socle sociétal », se traduit par des actions concrètes visant à :
- Assurer un environnement de travail sain et améliorer la qualité de vie de nos employés.
- Promouvoir des parcours professionnels équitables et faciliter l'accès aux emplois pour tous.
- Soutenir la parentalité en permettant une meilleure conciliation entre vie professionnelle et vie personnelle.
- Adopter une politique volontariste de non-discrimination et d'égalité des chances à l'embauche.


Le Groupe SAVENCIA est composé de deux entités : SAVENCIA Fromage & Dairy, acteur majeur de la transformation laitière et 5ème fabricant mondial de fromages avec des marques fortes, et SAVENCIA Gourmet, acteur international du Food Service Premium, également présent dans la distribution et les magasins et spécialisé dans la gastronomie sucrée / chocolat, la charcuterie et les marques de produits de la mer.


Pour en savoir plus : https://www.savencia.com/


En tant que futur Data Analyst, vous serez en charge de :


Collaborer avec les Business Analysts pour comprendre leurs besoins en matière de données et de reporting.

Co-créer et co-maintenir des tableaux de bord et des rapports Power BI pour répondre aux besoins des différentes unités métier.

Assurer la qualité et l'intégrité des données utilisées dans les rapports et tableaux de bord.

Former et accompagner les Business Analysts dans l'utilisation de Power BI pour qu'ils puissent devenir autonomes.

Participer à la définition et à la mise en œuvre des meilleures pratiques en matière de gouvernance des données.

Travailler en étroite collaboration avec le Data Product Owner pour aligner les initiatives de données avec les objectifs stratégiques de l'entreprise.



Avantages :

Environnement de travail stimulant et collaboratif.

Opportunités de développement professionnel et de formation continue.

Participation à des projets innovants et stratégiques pour l'entreprise.




Formation : Bac+5 en informatique, statistiques, data science ou domaine connexe.

Expérience : Une première expérience en tant que Data Analyst ou dans un rôle similaire est un plus, mais les candidats débutants avec une forte appétence pour les données et les outils de visualisation sont également encouragés à postuler.

Compétences techniques :

Maîtrise d'outil Business Intelligence tel que PowerBi ou équivalent (création de rapports, tableaux de bord, DAX, Power Query, Data Visualisation).
Connaissance des bases de données relationnelles et des langages SQL.
Compréhension des concepts de gouvernance des données et de qualité des données.

Compétences interpersonnelles :

Excellentes capacités d'écoute et de communication.
Aptitude à expliquer des concepts techniques de manière claire et pédagogique.
Capacité à travailler en équipe et à collaborer avec des profils variés.
Esprit analytique et rigoureux, orienté vers la résolution de problèmes.
Show more

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
¿El reto?

Te apetece unirte al equipo de Mutua Madrileña y formar parte de un proyecto único y en continuo crecimiento?

Buscamos un Analista de Datos para nuestra área de Planificación y Dimensionamiento, afrontando nuevos desafíos en un entorno dinámico y en constante evolución.

Valoramos a personas versátiles, con una actitud proactiva y capacidad para involucrarse tanto en tareas operativas como estratégicas.




¿Qué harás en tu día a día?

Diseño, desarrollo e implementación de procesos ETL adaptados a las necesidades del negocio, permitiendo analizar el comportamiento de actividad en las distintas plataformas.
Creación de informes y herramientas de análisis, facilitando la toma de decisiones mediante reportes automatizados.
Generación de simulaciones de escenarios para el análisis y evaluación de posibles resultados, con sólidos conocimientos en matemáticas y/o estadística.
Optimización de los recursos en las distintas plataformas de la empresa, asegurando la eficiencia y el rendimiento de los sistemas.
Desarrollo de aplicaciones para el monitoreo y control de KPIs del negocio.




¿Qué esperamos de ti?

Buscamos un profesional con Grado en carreras técnicas (Matemáticas, Estadística, Física o Ingeniería).
Experiencia mínima demostrable de al menos tres años en posición similar en otras compañías.
Imprescindible experiencia en el diseño y desarrollo de modelos de datos en SQL.
o Conocimientos en soluciones Microsoft 365, como Excel, Power BI, Power Apps, Power Automate.
Se valorarán conocimientos en Visual Basic y PySpark.




¿Qué te ofrecemos?

Un proyecto empresarial sólido y de futuro.
Posibilidades para formarte y desarrollarte profesionalmente.
Expertos profesionales con los que compartir tu experiencia.
Igualdad de oportunidades para desarrollarte profesionalmente.
Un excelente ambiente de trabajo que refleja en lo que creemos: compañerismo, profesionalidad, resultados y solidaridad.




En Grupo Mutua Madrileña, valoramos la diversidad y creemos en la igualdad de oportunidades para todos. Promovemos un entorno inclusivo donde la equidad salarial y la no discriminación son pilares fundamentales. Si buscas trabajar en una empresa que se compromete a que cada persona se sienta valorada y respetada, ¡nos encantaría conocerte!







¿Te sientes Preparado? ¿Eres Valiente? ¡Únete a nuestro reto profesional!

Grupo Mutua es para #PreparadosyValientes. Grupo Mutua es para ti.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - Rejoignez Learnation et devenez acteur d’une Edtech en pleine croissance !




✨ Qui sommes-nous ?

Chez Learnation Group, nous avons une ambition claire : révolutionner les solutions d’apprentissage linguistique. Notre groupe dynamique (150 collaborateurs) et en pleine expansion rassemble quatre sociétés complémentaires basées en France (Paris et Rouen), en Italie et au Maroc, qui forment un écosystème unique :

💼 7Speaking : Des offres conçues pour les RH et les entreprises, permettant à leurs collaborateurs de développer leurs compétences linguistiques et d’exceller dans un environnement professionnel international

🎓 PrepMyFuture : La référence dans la préparation aux certifications linguistiques (TOEIC, TOEFL, IELTS, etc.), grâce à des outils pédagogiques performants et accessibles

🌟 Educastream : Des solutions de formation linguistique personnalisées, adaptées aux besoins des particuliers pour les accompagner dans leur apprentissage et leur progression

🚀 Learnation : Le groupe visionnaire qui pilote l’ensemble, assure la cohérence stratégique et stimule l’innovation pour transformer l’apprentissage linguistique




Ensemble, nous aidons des milliers d’apprenants et d’organisations à maîtriser les langues, à explorer de nouvelles opportunités et à s’ouvrir au monde.




Notre philosophie ?

💡 Innovation : Être à la pointe des solutions et méthodes d’apprentissage.

🌍 Impact : Améliorer concrètement la vie de nos apprenants et de nos partenaires.

🏆 Performance : Obtenir des résultats mesurables, tout en visant l’excellence.




🌟 Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?

Une société en croissance : participez à une aventure entrepreneuriale passionnante
Une culture collaborative : tous les collaborateurs ont une voix qui compte et un rôle clé dans notre succès
Un impact tangible : chaque projet transforme la vie de nos clients
Une vision internationale : apprenez et collaborez avec des acteurs du monde entier.




Nous souhaitons intégrer des talents prêts à dépasser leurs limites, à innover et à rejoindre une entreprise où vos idées comptent vraiment. Que vous soyez expert dans votre domaine ou en quête d’une nouvelle aventure, Learnation Group vous offre un cadre idéal pour grandir et exceller.




🚀 Le contexte :

Nous recherchons un(e) Data Analyst prêt(e) à nous aider à tirer le meilleur de l’utilisation de nos données, sous la direction de notre CTPO. Ce rôle est clé pour soutenir la croissance de Learnation et renforcer sa position de leader dans le domaine des solutions linguistiques




Nous recherchons des talents prêts à dépasser leurs limites, à innover et à rejoindre une entreprise où vos idées comptent vraiment. Que vous soyez expert dans votre domaine ou en quête d’une nouvelle aventure, Learnation vous offre un cadre idéal pour grandir et exceller.













🛠️ Le rôle : Data Analyst




Missions principales :

Collecter, analyser et interpréter les données provenant de diverses sources pour fournir des insights exploitables.
Créer et maintenir des tableaux de bord et des rapports permettant de suivre les performances et les KPIs.
Collaborer avec les équipes produit, marketing, opérations, pédagogie, ventes, tech etc. pour identifier les besoins en données et fournir des analyses supportant les décisions stratégiques.
Collaborer avec les équipes techniques pour répondre aux usages fonctionnels tout en assurant la disponibilité et la sécurité des données conformément aux exigences internes et réglementaires
Assurer la qualité et l’intégrité des données, en mettant en place des processus de validation et de nettoyage.
Utiliser des outils de visualisation pour présenter les données de manière claire et compréhensible.
Mettre en place une stratégie de données globale pour guider les initiatives de collecte, d'analyse et d'utilisation des données.
Promouvoir une culture data au sein de l'organisation.




🎯 Ce que nous recherchons :

Minimum de 4 ans d'expérience en tant que Data Analyst ou dans un poste similaire, de préférence dans des entreprises utilisant un modèle SaaS.
Solide expérience avec les bases de données (MSSQL, PostgreSQL, MySQL) et de visualisation (Tableau, Power BI, etc.).
Connaissance approfondie des méthodologies statistiques et de modélisation des données.




✅ Votre profil idéal :

Excellente collaboration et communication avec les autres équipes.
Force de proposition et créativité.
Capacité de synthèse et rigueur analytique.




🎁 Ce que nous offrons :

Des opportunités d’évolution : la croissance rapide du groupe crée de nombreuses opportunités
Une flexibilité de l’organisation du travail : un accord de télétravail autorise jusqu’à 2 jours par semaine à distance
De nombreux avantages : RTT, carte titres restaurant, mutuelle responsable prise en charge à 100 % (y compris famille), cadre de travail agréable, accessible et central (Paris 8e), accès à nos plateformes de formation linguistique et à un portail de réduction/d’avantages salariés, évènements internes.




⚙️ Processus de recrutement :

Nous avons conçu un processus clair et humain pour identifier les meilleurs talents :

Echange téléphonique puis entretien visio avec Laurent, notre Responsable Recrutement, pour échanger sur votre parcours, vos attentes et vos motivations.
Entretien avec notre CPTO pour explorer votre expertise et vos ambitions.
Cas d’étude à réaliser, permettant d’évaluer vos compétences techniques et stratégiques.
Rencontre avec des membres du CODIR.







📣 Prêt(e) à nous rejoindre ?

Envoyez-nous votre candidature à : laurent.thienot@learnation.group et diane.monin@learnation.group

Vous voulez en savoir plus ? Consultez notre site : https://www.learnation.group/




🙌 Partagez cette offre !

Si ce poste n’est pas pour vous mais que vous connaissez quelqu’un qui correspond, n’hésitez pas à partager cette annonce !

HTML:
Data Analyst - Rejoignez Learnation et devenez acteur d’une Edtech en pleine croissance !


✨ Qui sommes-nous ?

Chez Learnation Group, nous avons une ambition claire : révolutionner les solutions d’apprentissage linguistique. Notre groupe dynamique (150 collaborateurs) et en pleine expansion rassemble quatre sociétés complémentaires basées en France (Paris et Rouen), en Italie et au Maroc, qui forment un écosystème unique :

💼 7Speaking : Des offres conçues pour les RH et les entreprises, permettant à leurs collaborateurs de développer leurs compétences linguistiques et d’exceller dans un environnement professionnel international

🎓 PrepMyFuture : La référence dans la préparation aux certifications linguistiques (TOEIC, TOEFL, IELTS, etc.), grâce à des outils pédagogiques performants et accessibles

🌟 Educastream : Des solutions de formation linguistique personnalisées, adaptées aux besoins des particuliers pour les accompagner dans leur apprentissage et leur progression

🚀 Learnation : Le groupe visionnaire qui pilote l’ensemble, assure la cohérence stratégique et stimule l’innovation pour transformer l’apprentissage linguistique


Ensemble, nous aidons des milliers d’apprenants et d’organisations à maîtriser les langues, à explorer de nouvelles opportunités et à s’ouvrir au monde.


Notre philosophie ?

💡 Innovation : Être à la pointe des solutions et méthodes d’apprentissage.

🌍 Impact : Améliorer concrètement la vie de nos apprenants et de nos partenaires.

🏆 Performance : Obtenir des résultats mesurables, tout en visant l’excellence.


🌟 Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?

  • Une société en croissance : participez à une aventure entrepreneuriale passionnante
  • Une culture collaborative : tous les collaborateurs ont une voix qui compte et un rôle clé dans notre succès
  • Un impact tangible : chaque projet transforme la vie de nos clients
  • Une vision internationale : apprenez et collaborez avec des acteurs du monde entier.

Title: Data analyst in controlling
HTML:
For over a decade, the Bosch Cluj Plant has become a strategic hub for innovation and production, making a significant impact on the technological landscape in Romania. Through our constant commitment to excellence in quality and innovation, we develop a diverse range of modern products for the mobility industry, focusing on delivering cutting-edge solutions to our international customers. Inspired by passion for technology, we have consistently evolved, solidifying our position as the most desired employer in Cluj for the engineering and business candidates. We pay special attention to the development of our community, inspiring future generations and governing our impact on the environment.

Our promise to our colleagues is rock-solid: we grow together, we enjoy our work, and inspire each other. Join us and see the difference.

Work



Job Description

Job Description

Are you driven to unlock the power of data and translate it into strategic insights? Are you passionate about digital transformation? Our cutting-edge manufacturing plant is searching for a data whiz to join our team! As we embrace Industry 4.0 and become a data-driven powerhouse, you'll play a key role in crafting informative reports and dashboards using Tableau and PowerBI. We need someone who will understand our business inside and out, and can design and implement BI solutions that fuel smart decision-making. You'll be a data maestro, wrangling information from various sources like our ERP (SAP), MES, and data warehouse to paint a clear picture through KPIs.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design, develop, and maintain scalable and insightful BI reports and dashboards using Tableau, PowerBI, and other relevant BI tools;
  • Work closely with cross-functional teams to gather and define data requirements that align with business goals, ensuring accurate representation of data in BI reports;
  • Understand and analyze data from our ERP (SAP), MES, and various local solutions, integrating them effectively to provide comprehensive insights;
  • Continuously enhance data collection methods to improve efficiency and accuracy, supporting the creation of a robust data warehouse for KPI reporting;
  • Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets, providing actionable insights to stakeholders;
  • Manage the deployment of BI solutions, ensuring they are user-friendly and accessible to all relevant parties within the organization;
  • Stay abreast of the latest industry trends and advancements in BI technology, recommending improvements to tools and processes;
  • Facilitate training and support for users of BI tools across the organization, fostering a data-driven culture;





Qualifications

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Data Analytics, or a related field;
  • Proven experience as a Data Analyst or Business Intelligence Analyst, with extensive experience in designing and implementing BI solutions.;
  • Expertise in BI tools such as Tableau and PowerBI is essential;
  • Strong understanding of ERP systems, preferably SAP, MES, and data warehouse technologies;
  • Proficient in SQL and experience in querying databases, data manipulation, and analysis;
  • Ability to work with large, complex data sets and transform them into insightful business information;
  • Excellent analytical skills, with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy;
  • Strong communication skills, capable of conveying complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders;
  • Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in a team environment as well as independently;
  • Proactive, curious, and innovative, with a strong problem-solving aptitude;

Additional Information

Benefits:

  • 25 days of annual leave – because your work-life balance is essential to us
  • Annual performance bonus up to two salaries – we appreciate your contribution to the company’s success
  • Annual salary review – we want you to feel fairly compensated for your hard work and dedication
  • Gift tickets worth 300 RON for Christmas and Easter
  • Flexible benefits – you will benefit from a monthly benefit budget that offers the possibility to customize the benefits package to suit your individual needs and preferences (You can opt for meal tickets worth 30 RON for every worked day or you can benefit from cultural tickets, gift tickets, or vacation vouchers, and discounts at restaurants, dentistry, shops, and many more)
  • Referral bonus - we encourage you to refer new candidates and you will be rewarded for it
  • Relocation package – we are committed to providing a supportive and inclusive work environment, so if you are recruited from another county, you will receive a special relocation bonus for 2 years which will help you to get settled in Cluj
  • Lunch discount – we have two canteens within our plant where you can eat your lunch at subsidized price
  • Flexible working hours – so that you can balance you work and personal obligations more effectively
  • Ability to work from the satellite Bosch location in Cluj-Napoca when it’s more convenient for you to do so
  • Home Office policy – you will benefit from a hybrid working model which takes into consideration the needs of each department in the plant and offers you the possibility to work from home when it is practical and convenient for you
  • Private medical insurance because health is a priority to us
  • Development Trainings - we have our own team of dedicated trainers that are providing specific trainings for personal and professional growth. In addition to this, we provide local development programs for Project Managers, Line Managers and Experts, external trainings, and assignments opportunities
  • Language courses – if your role demands it, you will have the chance to enhance your language skill set internally
  • Inspiring working conditions – we are committed to providing our employees a positive and fulfilling work experience
  • Transportation - to and from the Bosch Cluj Plant

Application Process

After you followed all the required steps on our platform, you will receive an e-mail for GDPR compliance.

Only those applicants who give their agreement will receive feedback from us.

Any other questions? Feel free to e-mail me at ioana.ilea@ro.bosch.com I will be back with an answer shortly.

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
Desde Novaquality Continuamos creciendo!! 🚀🚀Buscamos incorporar a nuestro equipo un/a Data Analyst para uno de nuestros principales clientes del sector de salud:




Funciones:

-Análisis del dato.

-Generación de informes.

-Extracción, tratamiento y carga de datos.

-Interlocución con las diferentes áreas




¿Qué buscamos?

- Perfil técnico.

-Experiencia de al menos 1 año de experiencia con las funciones nombradas.

-Conocimiento en tecnologías como: SAS,SQL.

-Capacidad de comunicación y trabajo en equipo.




¿Qué ofrecemos?

- Contratación indefinida en una empresa que está constantemente reinventando la manera de dar un mejor servicio a nuestros clientes.

-Modalidad híbrida con posibilidad de aumento en modalidad teletrabajo.

-Flexibilidad de entrada y salida.

- Jornada intensiva los viernes, jornada intensiva en verano.

- Buen ambiente laboral donde lo importante son las personas como tú.

- Plan de Formación continua con multitud de cursos en herramientas y tecnologías punteras, y cursos para la obtención de certificaciones.

- Evaluación de desempeño para el crecimiento de tu carrera profesional.

- Disfruta de nuestros Beneficios Sociales y accede al Plan de Retribución Flexible: seguro médico, tarjeta de transporte público, ticket restaurant y cheque guardería.




Si buscas incorporarte a un equipo dinámico, joven y altamente cualificado, donde se valore tu talento y experiencia, entonces... ERES de Novaquality. *(Nuestros Principios son Esfuerzo, Responsabilidad, Excelencia y Sinceridad).

Envíanos tu CV, atenderemos cuantas candidaturas sean recibidas.

Title: Data Analyst Power BI / 100% Remoto
Description:
Acabamos de cruzar el umbral de los 2400 talentos. Acabamos de empezar el segundo semestre del año, seguimos apostando por la tecnología y la innovación, y queremos contar contigo!




atSistemas ahora es !!!!!knowmad mood!!!!!




Una compañía líder en transformación digital que combina el talento y tecnología con la misión de aportar valor a más de 500 clientes.




A día de hoy, más de 2400 profesionales, una facturación de 129,2 millones de euros en 2022 y sedes en 7 países como España, Italia, Portugal, Reino Unido, Estado Unidos, Uruguay y Marruecos con casi 30 años de experiencia en el mercado tecnológico.




Si eres un apasionado de los Datos y estás buscando nuevos retos profesionales ¡esto te puede interesar!




Nuestra Comunidad Tecnológica experta en DATA & ANALYTICS no para de crecer y necesitamos incorporar un Senior Data Analyst con experiencia en Power BI y Azure.




Capacidades técnicas:

- Más de 3 años de experiencia trabajando con Power BI.

- Experiencia en el diseño y optimización de modelos de datos en Power BI (Data Modeling, DAX, Power Query - M).

- Experiencia en la integración de fuentes de datos diversas (SQL Server, Azure Synapse, Excel, APIs, etc.).

- Experiencia en Dataflows en Power BI.

- Desarrollo y mantenimiento de Workspaces y Apps en Power BI Service.

- Conocimiento en seguridad y gobernanza de datos en Power BI (Row Level Security, Object Level Security).




Funciones:

- Desarrollo de Dashboards: Diseñar, desarrollar y mantener dashboards interactivos y reportes utilizando Power BI para visualizar datos de manera precisa y eficiente

- Análisis de Datos: Realizar análisis de calidad de datos para identificar anomalías y oportunidades de mejora, proporcionando insights y recomendaciones a los stakeholders.

- Modelado Dimensional: Crear modelos de datos comprensivos para propósitos de reporte, utilizando diversas fuentes de datos.

- Optimización de Rendimiento: Optimizar reportes y consultas de Power BI para mejorar el rendimiento y la escalabilidad, asegurando un funcionamiento fluido con grandes conjuntos de datos.

- Aseguramiento de Calidad: Realizar pruebas exhaustivas y validación de reportes para asegurar su precisión y cumplimiento con los requisitos regulatorios.

- Documentación: Crear documentación detallada para los reportes desarrollados, incluyendo fuentes de datos, transformaciones y cálculos.

- Capacitación y Soporte: Proporcionar capacitación y soporte a los usuarios finales sobre la funcionalidad de Power BI, mejores prácticas y técnicas de resolución de problemas.

- Mejora Continua: Mantenerse informado sobre las tendencias de la industria, tecnologías emergentes y mejores prácticas en visualización y análisis de datos.




Modalidad de trabajo 100% Remoto.







knowmad mood es una compañía donde nos preocupamos por tu persona, tu felicidad, tu bienestar y tu salud.

Apostamos por la formación y el desarrollo de carrera.
Cultura human centric.
Potenciamos engagement y la escucha activa con las personas.
Nos preocupamos por la felicidad y el bienestar de las personas.

Work mood:

Vacaciones: Descansa para volver con más fuerza, 22 días de vacaciones + 2 días de libre disposición + 24 y 31 de diciembre.

Our mood:

Ofrecemos una nueva forma de trabajar más flexible

Flex work: favorecemos una jornada diaria flexible para que tú decidas a tu ritmo cuándo empieza tu vida personal y cuando termina tu jornada laboral.
Smart working: lo importante es que tú estés bien, tu desarrollo, y la orientación a resultados, no si vienes a la oficina.​ Por eso no hace falta ni que tengas la oficina cerca, mientras tengas una buena conexión, todo es posible.
Beneficios y ventajas: destina parte de tu salario a determinados productos como tarjeta de transporte, tarjeta restaurante, cheques guardería, seguro médico o formación.​ Además disfruta en nuestra plataforma interna de todos los descuentos exclusivos para tu vida fuera de la compañía.




knowmad mood nos encargamos de cuidar a nuestras personas y es un lugar fantástico en el que trabajar, convivir y desarrollarte.

Nos gusta escucharte: encuesta de felicidad, línea directa CEO, evaluación 360º
Cuidamos tu bienestar: a través de nuestro programa de bienestar integral centrado en: actividad física, nutrición saludable y equilibrio emocional.​
Y de tu vida: programa de conciliación 24 horas al día y 365 días del año para ti, tu pareja y tu familia: Consultas legales, asistente personal, plan dental, consulta veterinaria, gestor administrativa
Hacemos equipo: compartimos momentos de diversión, porque sabemos lo importante que es dedicar espacios donde conectar y reírnos más allá de los proyectos y equipos con nuestras actividades de team building: videojuegos online, scape room, ajedrez, etc
Nos gusta juntarnos: celebramos el verano y la navidad y nos reencontramos en nuestra Santa´s Summer Party y en nuestra Christmas Party.




Y si todo esto te parece poco, tenemos 𝐦𝐮𝐮𝐮𝐜𝐡𝐚𝐬 𝐬𝐨𝐫𝐩𝐫𝐞𝐬𝐚𝐬 que vamos realizando a lo largo del año.




#joinus

  • Beneficios y ventajas: destina parte de tu salario a determinados productos como tarjeta de transporte, tarjeta restaurante, cheques guardería, seguro médico o formación.​ Además disfruta en nuestra plataforma interna de todos los descuentos exclusivos para tu vida fuera de la compañía.


knowmad mood nos encargamos de cuidar a nuestras personas y es un lugar fantástico en el que trabajar, convivir y desarrollarte.

  • Nos gusta escucharte: encuesta de felicidad, línea directa CEO, evaluación 360º
  • Cuidamos tu bienestar: a través de nuestro programa de bienestar integral centrado en: actividad física, nutrición saludable y equilibrio emocional.​
  • Y de tu vida: programa de conciliación 24 horas al día y 365 días del año para ti, tu pareja y tu familia: Consultas legales, asistente personal, plan dental, consulta veterinaria, gestor administrativa
  • Hacemos equipo: compartimos momentos de diversión, porque sabemos lo importante que es dedicar espacios donde conectar y reírnos más allá de los proyectos y equipos con nuestras actividades de team building: videojuegos online, scape room, ajedrez, etc
  • Nos gusta juntarnos: celebramos el verano y la navidad y nos reencontramos en nuestra Santa´s Summer Party y en nuestra Christmas Party.


Y si todo esto te parece poco, tenemos 𝐦𝐮𝐮𝐮𝐜𝐡𝐚𝐬 𝐬𝐨𝐫𝐩𝐫𝐞𝐬𝐚𝐬 que vamos realizando a lo largo del año.


#joinus

Title: Junior Insights Analyst
Description:
Job Description

Dublin/Hybrid - Customer Success Team

About This Job

Our Analysts are vital to NielsenIQ’s success. They work every day with our client base, which includes most of the major brands you see in the supermarket. We also work with most of the supermarkets and other retailers where you’ll find these products. If you saw it the last time you did your weekly shop, they’re probably a NielsenIQ client, as is the shop. They all rely on our people.

Our clients come to us with challenges and questions ranging from deciding on new product development, designing a new price strategy, and much more! NielsenIQ’s Analysts work with our clients to create and present analyses based on the world’s best datasets. Our insights team support clients in Health and Beauty, Beers, Wine and Spirits or Grocery.

Our staff are confident and capable crafters of compelling insights, deliver clear and actionable recommendations to our clients helping them grow their business.  

A successful candidate for this role will be someone who can establish strong relationships with both our clients and our colleagues. You will quickly become a trusted partner, working with many of our clients’ teams, including marketing, sales, category, and many more. You will be expected to understand our clients’ needs and then create and present solutions that help achieve their strategic and tactical goals.

If telling stories through data excites you but you’re uncertain whether you have the data knowledge: get in touch. We have an excellent training program, ensuring you understand all our products and how we create analyses.

Responsibilities


Have a strong working knowledge of the client business priorities and the role we can play in supporting these goals (e.g., participating in business cycles such as brand planning & range reviews etc.)
Understand the impact we can have on personal objectives of individuals at our clients
Responsible for setting up client onboarding for analytics & insights services and conducting tactical client training for Guided Analytics & NielsenIQ tools such as Connect Express and Discover
Responsible for identifying opportunities through day-to-day engagements with our clients, handing off opportunities to Account Development to pursue


Qualifications


Excellent time management and prioritization skills with a proven track record of delivering projects on time
Confident numerically
Ability to analyse data confidently
Problem solving and solutions orientated
Performs work accurately and effectively with attention to detail
Engaging presenter
Good at building relationships, internally and with clients
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Experience of working in an analytical environment
An understanding of the FMCG industry and trends
Capable of leveraging tools such as Microsoft excel and PowerPoint


What We Can Offer

We provide the most complete and trusted view of consumers and markets in 90 countries covering 90% of the world’s populations. Focusing on consumer-packaged goods manufacturers and retailers, we combine unparalleled datasets, pioneering technology, and the industry’s top talent to create insights that unlock innovation and redefine what’s possible.

Working with our Customer Success team gives you access to:


Our amazing 'people first' culture with plenty of flexibility
Career & Learning development
Making an impact on biggest FMCG manufacturers' growth
Becoming an expert in categories that shape UK retail
Joining a market leader where you’ll gain a broad perspective – a market overview of different categories and products. A truly global and diverse organisation with global opportunities.
Access to first-class analytical tools which is a great way to gain understanding of CPG market in general
Great deal of autonomy in performing your role
Exposure to major players on the market such as: P&G, Coca-cola, Unilever, Nestle


Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion
