Title: Data-analyst
Description:
Profile Data Analyst

General Description:

The data analyst is responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data to provide valuable insights that support decision-making within the organization. This role requires an in-depth knowledge of data analysis techniques and tools.




TPEX and the Evolution towards Autonomous Buildings

At TPEX International, we strive to lead the evolution towards autonomous buildings. Our mission is to transform buildings into self-regulating, sustainable, and efficient environments through advanced technologies and innovative solutions.




Intelligent Systems: We integrate advanced systems capable of collecting and analyzing real-time data. These systems help optimize energy consumption, improve indoor climate, and minimize operational costs.

Digital Twins: By utilizing Digital Twins, we can create virtual models of our buildings. These models allow us to perform simulations, monitor performance, and plan proactive maintenance.

Automation: We develop and implement tools that automate various aspects of building management. This includes reading building data and directing suppliers based on this information.

Sustainability: Our commitment to sustainability remains a core value. By reducing waste and promoting a culture of sustainability, we aim for buildings that not only meet today's needs but also leave a positive legacy for future generations.

Collaboration and Innovation: We work closely with various departments and external partners to ensure continuous innovation. Our R&D department plays a crucial role in developing new technologies and solutions that contribute to our vision of autonomous buildings.

At TPEX International, we are determined to play a leading role in the transition to autonomous buildings. Our expertise and dedication to innovation enable us to manage buildings that are not only efficient and sustainable but also future-ready.




What You Will Do:

As a data analyst, you will manage, analyze, and maintain building data accurately. Your core task is to convey data accurately to the end customer. You ensure that the data is accurate and complete, as our automatic tools will not work accurately otherwise. Besides these tasks, there is time and space to develop yourself and contribute to the R&D department. Here we develop tools to automate aspects of building management. Think of reading buildings and directing suppliers based on this information.




Responsibilities:

Collecting and processing large datasets from various sources.
Analyzing data to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Developing reports and dashboards to visualize and communicate findings.
Collaborating with various departments to identify data needs and translate them into actionable insights.
Ensuring the integrity and quality of the data.
Advising stakeholders based on data analysis and findings.




Required Skills:

Analytical Thinking: Ability to analyze and interpret complex data to obtain valuable insights.
Technical Skills: Experience with data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, R, and data visualization tools such as PowerBI, Tableau & Azure.
Problem-Solving Ability: Able to identify problems and develop effective solutions based on data analysis.
Communication: Strong oral and written communication skills to present findings clearly and concisely to stakeholders.
Detail-Oriented: Accuracy and attention to detail when working with data to ensure the integrity and quality of the data.
Collaboration: Ability to work effectively with various departments and teams to identify data needs and translate them into actionable insights.




Working Conditions:

Vacation Days: 25 vacation days per year.
Company Lunch: A joint lunch every Tuesday.
Team: Working in a small, close-knit team.
Team events: Regular fun team events.
Work Environment: Particularly inspiring environment in the EDGE Stadium in Amsterdam.
Salary indication: €3.800,- tot €4.500,- depending on experience and skill.

Title: DATA ANALYST H/F
Description:
Notre client BESSON CHAUSSURES est une PME de 70 collaborateurs engagés dans la gestion globale de 200 magasins, répartis en France, en Belgique et en Espagne, ainsi que d'un site e-commerce. Depuis plus de 40 ans, l'exigence de qualité est au cœur de l'engagement de BESSON CHAUSSURES. L'enseigne propose les prix les plus compétitifs du marché et libère ainsi ses clients du choix entre la qualité et le prix.




Dans le cadre d'un remplacement, BESSON CHAUSSURES recrute un DATA ANALYST H/F dans un contexte de croissance. En rapportant directement au Directeur des Systèmes d'Informations, vous intégrez le service informatique composé de profils pluridisciplinaires (Développeurs, Chefs de Projets, Responsable et Technicien Support). Vous avez la responsabilité d'exploiter et d'interpréter les données afin de soutenir les directions métiers dans leurs choix stratégiques. Vos missions sont les suivantes :




Analyser les données pour identifier les tendances et définir des insights pertinents

Traiter, exploiter et intégrer des données avec les développeurs dans un entrepôt de données

Produire des analyses et formuler des préconisations aux directeurs et managers ;

définir des indicateurs et créer des tableaux de bord automatisés sous Power BI pour visualiser les résultats de l'analyse

Développer et mettre en œuvre des modèles prédictifs pour soutenir la prise de décision

Effectuer la veille technologique afin d'améliorer les processus et outils existants




Cette description prend en compte les principales responsabilités et missions ; elle n'est pas limitative.




Caractéristiques du poste




Rémunération : Selon profil et expérience

Localisation : AUBIERE (63 – CLERMONT-FERRAND)




Profil recherché




Formation : Issu(e) d'une formation supérieure en informatique, ou en Data, de type Master, Ecole d'Ingénieur ou équivalent.

Expérience : Vous disposez d'une expérience significative en conception et développement de tableaux de bord sur l'un des produits suivants : Power BI, Qliksense, Tableau, Business Object/SAP BW et en programmation objet dans l'un des langages suivants : Java, Scala, Python, … Une expertise en SQL, une bonne connaissance des principes de fonctionnement des BDD relationnelles et une autonomie dans la conception de schémas de données est nécessaire. Vous maîtrisez les concepts des statistiques descriptives et des probabilités. De bonnes connaissances générales en machine learning, en intelligence artificielle et dans le domaine de la sécurité des applications informatiques sont un vrai plus. Un anglais écrit est indispensable, l'oral est un atout. Vous savez travailler en mode projet et utiliser des outils de PMO. Une connaissance des métiers du retail et de la logistique serait un plus.

Qualités requises : Reconnu(e) pour votre sens de la communication, vous savez présenter des résultats d'analyse de manière claire et convaincante. Vous savez abstraire et formaliser votre travail. Vos capacités de prise de recul vous permettent d'avoir une vision d'ensemble et d'être force de proposition pour l'amélioration de l'architecture. Vous aimez travailler en équipe et en transversalité. Curieux(se), vous avez à cœur de comprendre les métiers et le business, pour mieux identifier le rôle des données sur lesquelles vous travaillez. Rigoureux(se) et organisé(e), vous savez hiérarchiser vos priorités et faire preuve de réactivité. Vous recherchez un contexte de travail dans une structure à taille humaine, avec beaucoup d'autonomie, ce poste est pour vous.

Title: ALTERNANCE- Data Analyst H/F
Description:
TotalEnergies est une compagnie multi-énergies mondiale de production et de fourniture d'énergies : pétrole et biocarburants, gaz naturel et gaz verts, renouvelables et électricité. Ses 105 000 collaborateurs s'engagent pour une énergie toujours plus abordable, propre, fiable et accessible au plus grand nombre. Présent dans plus de 130 pays, TotalEnergies inscrit le développement durable dans toutes ses dimensions au cœur de ses projets et opérations pour contribuer au bien-être des populations.


Les études de fiabilité disponibilité visent à simuler différents paramètres de production, de réduction des émissions de CO2, d'arrêt/panne afin d'anticiper le comportement d'une installation pétrolière.

Pour cela de nombreuses données sont nécessaires, notamment des données de fiabilité (taux de panne, durée de rétablissement...) sur les équipements.

TotalEnergies a mis en œuvre sa propose base de données au format ISO14224 / Oreda.

Un travail constant est nécessaire pour entretenir la qualité des données et pour analyser son contenu.

Vos missions seront les suivantes :

- Compléter la base de données de fiabilité et trouver des méthodes pour automatiser la collecte

- Analyser la qualité de celle-ci (ex : complétion des attributs, précision des résultats, détection d'anomalies)

- Analyser son contenu (ex : distribution des taux de panne, écart entre fabricants, évolution des taux dans le temps)

- Mettre en place des dashboard (ex : PowerBI) permettant de visualiser les analyses ci-dessus

- Faire des recommandations sur les taux de défaillance de référence par famille d'équipements dans un doc. interne

Vous évoluerez au sein d'une équipe de professionnels confirmés et auprès d'un tuteur-coach, le référent de votre futur métier. Un accompagnement individualisé vous permettra de favoriser votre autonomie et de vous mener à votre diplôme !

Actuellement en deuxième année d'un cycle Ingénieur ou 1ère année de Master, vous préparez pour la rentrée de septembre 2025 un Bac+5 dans une école d'Ingénieur ou Université, avec une spécialisation Data / Mathématiques / Statistiques et êtes à la recherche d'une alternance de 12 mois.
Merci d'indiquer le rythme de votre alternance sur votre CV ou Lettre de motivation.


Compétences Techniques :

Connaissance en statistiques / mathématiques
Modélisation de données
Des notions en mécanique/instrumentation seraient en plus
Anglais Opérationnel

Compétences IT :

Python
SQL
PowerBI

Aptitudes :

Rigueur
Autonomie
Curiosité et ouverture d'esprit

Vous vous reconnaissez ? N'attendez plus... postulez pour rejoindre les équipes TotalEnergies du CSTJF à Pau !

Show more

Un travail constant est nécessaire pour entretenir la qualité des données et pour analyser son contenu.

Vos missions seront les suivantes :

- Compléter la base de données de fiabilité et trouver des méthodes pour automatiser la collecte

- Analyser la qualité de celle-ci (ex : complétion des attributs, précision des résultats, détection d'anomalies)

- Analyser son contenu (ex : distribution des taux de panne, écart entre fabricants, évolution des taux dans le temps)

- Mettre en place des dashboard (ex : PowerBI) permettant de visualiser les analyses ci-dessus

- Faire des recommandations sur les taux de défaillance de référence par famille d'équipements dans un doc. interne

Vous évoluerez au sein d'une équipe de professionnels confirmés et auprès d'un tuteur-coach, le référent de votre futur métier. Un accompagnement individualisé vous permettra de favoriser votre autonomie et de vous mener à votre diplôme !

Actuellement en deuxième année d'un cycle Ingénieur ou 1ère année de Master, vous préparez pour la rentrée de septembre 2025 un Bac+5 dans une école d'Ingénieur ou Université, avec une spécialisation Data / Mathématiques / Statistiques et êtes à la recherche d'une alternance de 12 mois.
Merci d'indiquer le rythme de votre alternance sur votre CV ou Lettre de motivation.

Compétences Techniques :

  • Connaissance en statistiques / mathématiques
  • Modélisation de données
  • Des notions en mécanique/instrumentation seraient en plus
  • Anglais Opérationnel

Compétences IT :

  • Python
  • SQL
  • PowerBI

Aptitudes :

  • Rigueur
  • Autonomie
  • Curiosité et ouverture d'esprit

Vous vous reconnaissez ? N'attendez plus... postulez pour rejoindre les équipes TotalEnergies du CSTJF à Pau !

Title: Data Governance Analyst (Remoto)
Description:
Kiteris es una empresa joven y ágil dedicada a brindar servicios de gestión de servicios y proyectos TI de integración de software, basados en la entrega de excelencia, la calidad de nuestro equipo y la aportación de valor a través de la especialización y la innovación. Estamos ubicados en España y Portugal, pero trabajamos para diferentes clientes en Europa, USA, y LATAM.




En Kiteris Data, el grupo de Business Intelligence de Kiteris Solutions, estamos buscando una persona para desarrollar la función de Arquitecto de datos o Data Governance.




Nuestro objetivo es comprender los retos del negocio de nuestros clientes y crear aplicaciones analíticas sólidas y escalables para ayudarlos a mejorar su proceso de análisis y toma de decisiones.




Te unirás a un proyecto europeo de alto impacto donde un equipo de expertos en datos con alta visibilidad en el programa que te mentorizarán y acompañarán en tu curva de aprendizaje. Los Data Spaces en Europa representan un esfuerzo coordinado para potenciar el uso y la compartición de datos de forma segura y estructurada, impulsando tanto la innovación tecnológica como la competitividad a nivel europeo.







Principales responsabilidades:




Gestión y trazabilidad de datos, asegurando alineación con los procesos de negocio.
Asesoramiento en gobernanza y calidad del dato, garantizando conformidad con estándares europeos (Gaia-X, IDSA).
Diseño y validación de arquitectura de datos en diferentes entornos del programa.
Estrategias de interoperabilidad y middleware para la integración con Data Spaces europeos.
Identificación y cumplimiento de estándares de seguridad en almacenamiento y manejo de datos (GDPR).
Colaboración en la definición y estandarización de APIs de datos.
Evaluación de riesgos en infraestructura de datos y recomendación de estrategias de mitigación.
Revisión y validación de modelos de datos y ontologías para garantizar interoperabilidad.
Evaluación de escenarios técnicos y arquitectónicos, asegurando su viabilidad.
Coordinación con equipos de desarrollo, arquitectura y QA para asegurar calidad y cumplimiento.
Revisión de documentación técnica y entregables.







Experiencia y actitudes/aptitudes necesarias:

Generales:

Inglés B2 – C1 imprescindible
Permiso de trabajo en España.
Mentalidad analítica.
Trabajo en equipo.
Actitud proactiva y ganas de aprender.




Técnicas:

Experiencia sólida en Gobernanza y Arquitectura de Datos.
Background técnico en proyectos de Data.
Conocimientos en gestión de proyectos y coordinación de equipos.
Capacidad analítica y enfoque crítico para evaluar escenarios técnicos y arquitectónicos.







¿Qué ofrecemos?

Trabajo 100% en remoto.
Flexibilidad horaria.
Contrato indefinido.
Incorporación inmediata.
Revisión salarial continuada.
Plan de carrera profesional en empresa en crecimiento.
La posibilidad de aprender y analizar diferentes modelos de negocio (Empresas de servicios IT, comercialización eléctrica, empresas de consumo, empresas del sector agrícola, empresas del sector industrial...).
Formación continua en tecnología, soft-skills e inglés.
Seguro médico privado cofinanciado.
Ticket restaurante, transporte y guardería.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst H/F
Description:
POUR VOUS, TOUT COMMENCE ICI !




Envie de faire vraiment la différence dans les projets de vie de vos clients et de relever tous les challenges qui s’offrent à vous ? Oui ? Alors, vous êtes au bon endroit pour cela !




Dans le cadre de son développement, le Crédit Agricole d’Aquitaine recherche pour son équipe Data, un Data Analyst H/F. Vous collaborerez avec les équipes métiers et IT pour transformer les besoins business en analyses concrètes et recommandations stratégiques. Votre rôle sera essentiel pour transformer les données brutes en informations exploitables, permettant ainsi de prendre des décisions stratégiques éclairées.




Tout le monde connaît le Crédit Agricole ! Vraiment ? 1er financeur de l’économie française, nous sommes aussi la Banque Universelle de Proximité et nos 2772 collaborateurs dans 242 agences et sièges agissent dans l’intérêt de nos clients et celui de la société avec proximité, responsabilité et solidarité.




SOYEZ ENGAGÉS avec nous ! Vos principales MISSIONS :




En collaboration étroite avec les équipes métiers (par exemple : pilotage commercial, assurances, crédits, risques), il/elle traduit les besoins business en analyses concrètes et en recommandations ​stratégiques, grâce à des visualisations percutantes et des indicateurs clairs :​




Collecte et préparation de données : collecter, nettoyer et structurer les données issues de différentes sources (CRM, Webtracking, Open Data, Filiales, API, …), et garantir leur qualité, cohérence et fiabilité pour les analyses​
Analyses exploratoires : identifier des tendances, corrélations et anomalies dans les données, et répondre aux problématiques métiers en fournissant des analyses claires et des enseignements exploitables​
Conception de tableaux de bord et rapports : développer des tableaux de bord interactifs pour suivre des KPI et aider au pilotage des activités, et automatiser les rapports récurrents pour les équipes métiers et la direction​
Accompagnement à la prise de décision : collaborer avec les équipes métiers pour transformer les enseignements en actions concrètes​
Veille technologique et innovation : identifier des opportunités d’optimisation dans les processus existants grâce aux données et rester à jour sur les outils et technique d’analyse de données ​







Package de rémunération : votre travail crée notre valeur : salaire à partir de 3300 euros brut par mois, rémunération variable, 13ème mois, prime d’intéressement, de participation.
Avantages adaptés à votre quotidien : l’équilibre vie privée, vie professionnelle chez nous, c’est important : 25 jours de congés payés, RTT, jours de télétravail. Bien sûr, tickets restaurants, mutuelle et prévoyance font parties intégrante du package.
Etre là pour vous à chaque étape : vous êtes notre priorité. Dès les premiers jours, nous sommes là en vous proposant un parcours d’intégration.
87% des collaborateurs se disent fiers de travailler pour le Crédit Agricole.




Et si c’était vous notre futur collègue ?




Nous sommes engagés au quotidien pour l’égalité des chances, en valorisant chaque talent. Depuis 2006, nous sommes fiers de notre engagement en faveur de l'emploi des personnes en situation de handicap.




Profil :




Vous êtes issu(e) d'une formation BAC+5 en statistiques, mathématiques, et/ou informatique décisionnelle et vous disposez d’une expérience d’1 à 3 ans dans un poste similaire, idéalement dans un environnement bancaire.




Compétences techniques :




Maîtrise des langages de programmation et des bases de données : SQL (requêtes avancées et optimisation), Python pour l’analyse est un plus
Maîtrise d’outils de manipulation de données : SAS, BO, SQL Server
Maîtrise d’outils de visualisation de données : Tableau, Power BI, QlikView, Microstrategy serait un plus
Connaissance des bases relationnelles et des data warehouses (Hive de préférence)
Connaissance des concepts de base en analyse statistique (régressions, tests d’hypothèse, intervalle de confiance, …)

Compétences métiers et relationnelles :




Capacité à comprendre des enjeux métiers et à aligner les solutions data avec les objectifs stratégiques
Excellentes compétences en communication pour vulgariser des résultats complexes
Esprit analytique, curiosité et capacité à résoudre des problèmes complexes
Capacité à travailler en équipe dans des environnements pluridisciplinaires
Organisation et gestion des priorités dans des projets multi-tâches
Proactivité et autonomie







Les données personnelles recueillies par la présente, par le Crédit Agricole d’Aquitaine, en qualité de Responsable de traitement sont nécessaires pour étudier votre candidature. Elles seront conservées pendant une durée de 18 mois et ne seront donc pas utilisées pour d’autres finalités.

Nous vous invitons également à consulter la Charte de protection des données personnelles des candidats du Groupe Crédit Agricole disponible sur l’intranet de recrutement du Groupe à l’adresse suivante : https://www.groupecreditagricole.jobs/Charte-Candidats

Show more

  • Maîtrise d’outils de manipulation de données : SAS, BO, SQL Server
  • Maîtrise d’outils de visualisation de données : Tableau, Power BI, QlikView, Microstrategy serait un plus

  • Excellentes compétences en communication pour vulgariser des résultats complexes
  • Esprit analytique, curiosité et capacité à résoudre des problèmes complexes

Title: Data Analyst (Data&Analytics, Freshful Team)
HTML:
We’re always looking for the ones truly passionate about their work. If you are amongst them, you can rest assured there is a place for you in eMAG. We’ve grown very fast and are determined to keep doing so. What brought us here is our desire for continuous evolution and practical results.


More than 6000 colleagues are part of eMAG Teams. We strongly believe in people's development and therefore every year we invest more and more energy and resources to remain an organization that is constantly learning. We want to ensure that you’ll have the most talented colleagues and the proper environment to grow and achieve great results, to become what you desire on a personal and professional level. Join us, grow faster!



As a Data Analyst, you will work closely with stakeholders across the organization to understand their data needs and provide them with relevant insights and recommendations to support business decisions and goals.



What you’ll have to do:

  • Gather and aggregate relevant data from various sources, such as internal Databases, Google Analytics and BigQuery, Business Intelligence resources;
  • Analyze complex user datasets using data visualization and statistical tools;
  • Analyze user behavior data to identify patterns, preferences, and potential areas for improvement;
  • Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to visualize and communicate insights effectively to stakeholders;
  • Collaborate with data engineering teams to ensure data integrity, quality, and accessibility for analysis purposes;
  • Stay updated with industry best practices and emerging trends in e-commerce analytics and user behavior analysis.


What makes you a good fit:

  • Have 1+ years experience as a Data Analyst or similar positions;
  • Have SQL experience;
  • Have experience with at least one data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI);
  • Have strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to work with complex datasets;
  • Able to translate business problems into quantitative analyses and produce useful insights;
  • Have excellent communication skills to present findings and collaborate effectively with teams;
  • Able to work independently;
  • Excellent English communication skills (spoken and written).


What makes you stand out:

  • Have strong understanding of e-commerce KPIs and user behavior analysis methodologies;
  • Knowledge of Pyhton;
  • Experience of working within structured and Agile project environments;
  • University degree in Economics, Computer Science, or equivalent professional experience.


What we’ve prepared for you:

  • Medical subscription: Medicover, MedLife or Regina Maria.
  • A flexible budget that you can invest in yourself as you wish: meal tickets, holiday tickets, cultural vouchers, private pension, foreign language classes, eMAG, Fashion Days, Tazz, Therme & Genius, membership to different gyms or even professional development classes.
  • Different discounts from our partners: banking, mobile, dental medicine or wellness.
  • Access to the Bookster library and free credits on the Hilio psycho-emotional health platform.
  • An accelerated learning environment, with access to over 100.000 curated online resources and platforms, learning academies and development programs.
  • New headquarters, where sleek design, natural light, and versatile spaces create an energizing and comfortable environment for hybrid work.


Curious to find out more about the next step in your career? Apply now and if your experience is relevant for the role you wish, we will give you a call for more details!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you looking for an opportunity to accelerate their career…




They're looking for a Senior Analytics Engineer , to join them in their office in Utrecht, for where you would be responsible for playing a key role in designing, building, and maintaining ELT pipelines using a modern technology toolkit, Collaborate with stakeholders to drive data-informed decision-making processes. Develop and enhance visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau

You must be experienced in :

Proven experience in building and maintaining data pipelines and ETL processes.
Hands-on experience with dbt (data build tool)
Advanced SQL skills and intermediate Python proficiency.
Strong expertise in visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau)
Proficiency in Dutch and English

Would you like to hear more about the opportunity?

Apply or reach out directly so we can discuss it in more detail.




B.javaid@gcstechtalent.com

Title: Data Analyst (PowerBI)
Description:
Who are we:

Neotalent Conclusion is one of the leading Iberian specialists providing services in Information Technology and Engineering services. As part of the Netherlands-based organization Conclusion, which has an ecosystem of over 25 companies and 3,600 employees, we are focused on increasing the technological capacity of our clients and the digital transformation of their application ecosystems.

We are talent specialists, attracting the best people and combining them with the needs of the most ambitious projects, at the right time. Our success comes from our investments in innovation, our focus on results, and, above all, the guarantee that our people will have happy and rewarding careers.

With over 25 years of solid experience, Neotalent Conclusion has established its presence in key locations, including Lisbon, Porto, and Madrid. The company currently has more than 950 professionals in the different areas in which it operates.




Neotalent, the responsive people.




Find out more about us at www.neotalent.pt.




Role Overview:

We are looking for a Data Analyst (PowerBI) to join one of our biggest clients in the Porto area (Hybrid). A multinational financial services firm, one of the largest financial groups and among the 30 largest financial institution’s globally.




What you will do:

Create and update PowerBI Dashboards
Collect data (internal & external) and investigate their business value through data analysis and visualization
Create and adapt data analysis models and tools
Mount, execute and automate ETL processes for extracting data (with python and SQL) to serve analytical needs
Develop & improve data quality controls and standardize processes and analyses
Use previous experience in marketing topics to translate business needs
Collect and visualize KPIs on the performance of our in-house models
Basic knowledge of data python packages




What you are like:

At least 4 years of experience as a Data Analyst;
Experience with PowerBI;
Strong understanding of Agile methodologies and frameworks, particularly Scrum;
Excellent communication skills - English;




Why join us

Work on challenging projects for big clients
Learn more about emerging technologies
Possibility of working remotely
Design your career plan
Access to continuous training and certifications
Evolve through our internal mobility program
… and much more!
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a Data Analyst seeking a new interesting challenge? 🔍

If your answer is yes, it’s your lucky day so keep reading, it can be just what you're looking for! 👀




✍️WHAT WILL YOU DO?

We are looking for a dynamic, proactive and talented person to join our team and perform the following tasks:

• Working with stakeholders to understand the business problem they're trying to solve and the as-is landscape.

• Collaborating with others and analyzing large unstructured, previously unseen datasets to source and build understanding of relevant data.

• Building advanced SQL scripts to connect data from across our data lake to analyze and validate data mappings.

• Identifying data anomalies and data quality issues and ensuring these are handled or flagged appropriately.

• Choosing and deploying appropriate analytical and statistical techniques to understand issues, identify trends and forecast performance.

• Working with architecture and technical (engineering) teams where required to develop robust, automated solutions for regular data and insights needs.

• Working in an agile manner, ensuring the outputs required are in line with stakeholder expectations and delivered on-time.

• Developing outputs to summarize analytical findings clearly for stakeholders

• Interacting with various levels within the organization, from entry level team members to senior management.




🧐 WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

• Years' experience: minimum 5 years in a similar role

• Fluent English

• Experience of translating business problems into data solutions, adopting the most appropriate tools and techniques for the job.

• Good understanding of financial services business concepts and key metrics.

• Knowledge of mathematical and statistical concepts and when to apply these.

• Identifies research and reports on beneficial data usage opportunities in different departments or environments.

• Strong analytical skills including:

1. Ability to provide observations and comment.

2. Wider-thinking and problem solving – identifying and delivering reporting through own initiative.

3. Utilizing the data to build out a compelling narrative for stakeholders.

4. Understanding of the change management process.




📅 WHERE AND WHEN?

Workplace: Remote (Candidate should live in Spain)
Work Schedule: Business Hours




🤝 WHAT CAN WE OFFER YOU?

Permanent contract 📋 - We offer indefinite contracts from the first day.
Pay and benefits 💸 - Competitive salary and a flexible compensation plan adapted to your needs (Ticket restaurant plan, Childcare Ticket, Transport Ticket and Health Insurance).
Work from home 🏚️ - We offer you a financial support every month for your working from home expenses. In addition, in the first month we will give you a bonus to help you to set up your workplace👨‍💻
Opportunity knocks 👍🏻 - Being a part of a growing company, we want to support your path with a career development plan and annual performance-based compensation reviews.
Learn as you grow 📚 - Starting with a fantastic onboarding program, TCS has robust learning platforms that will allow you to learn and grow personal as professionally.
Bring your buddy 👫 - If you have referred a friend for an open position under the BYB Scheme and she/he is hired you’ll receive a very attractive cash award.
Connect globally 🌏 - Work with people from all over the world. You can feel the multicultural workforce.
Benefit from being a TCSer 🎟️ – By being part of the TCS Spain family you can enjoy benefits, offers and corporate discounts on the best brands.
And so on 🎉 - Appreciations, incentives, Team Building activities, diversity and inclusion programs, sustainability activities, corporative events... This has only just begun!




💡WHO ARE WE?

Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is an Information Technology (IT) company founded in 1968 as part of the Indian Tata Group and is one of the top 3 technology companies globally 🚀




With a presence in 55 countries and more than 600,000 employees, TCS is considered one of the 10 best companies to work for worldwide in 2024 according to the Top Employers Institute 🥇




TCS Spain started operations in 2001 and currently has a diverse workforce that collaborates with the main Spanish and multinational companies 🌏




TCS Spain has been certified as a Top Employer 2024 and has also been chosen as one of the 100 Best Companies to Work for in Spain in 2024 according to Forbes🏆




Among the portfolio of services, TCS has information technology services, asset-based solutions, global consulting, engineering and industrial services, digital solutions and services, application maintenance and development, quality assurance and testing services, IT infrastructure and BPS 🎯




Responsible for development, TCS Spain is committed to inclusion, diversity and sustainability, and promotes flexibility policies that support wellbeing and work-life balance 💯




WELCOME, WE ARE WAITING FOR YOU! 🚀

Title: Junior Data Analyst
HTML:
At DSK Bank, we are seeking a motivated Junior Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. This role will provide the right candidate with an opportunity to grow their skills in business intelligence and data analysis, while contributing to our company's data-driven approach to decision making.


Main Responsibilities:


· Design and develop effective business intelligence dashboards using Power BI, focusing on clear and informative data visualization techniques to communicate insights to stakeholders;

· Analyze complex data sets to identify trends, patterns, and relationships relevant to visualizations. Translate these insights into clear and actionable stories for audiences through data visualization;

· Partner with business stakeholders to understand their needs and objectives. Translate those needs into compelling data visualizations that effectively communicate insights;

· Prepare data for visualization by wrangling and cleaning datasets from Oracle databases. Write SQL queries to extract relevant data for visualizations;


Ideal Candidate:


  • Education: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field;
  • Experience: Proven experience in data visualization, business intelligence (BI) development, data science, or a relevant role involving data management;
  • Technical Skills: Hands-on experience with BI technologies, specifically Power BI. Writing SQL queries, particularly for Oracle databases, is a strong advantage;
  • Soft Skills: Strong problem-solving skills and a meticulous eye for detail. Ability to thrive in a collaborative team environment. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively translate data insights to stakeholders;


We offer:


  • Excellent opportunities for professional and career development in one of Bulgaria’s leading banks;
  • Food vouchers in the amount up to 200 BGN per month;
  • 20 + 5 paid holiday leave;
  • Additional Health Insurance;
  • Favorable conditions for housing and mortgage lending, as well as for bank products and services;
  • Preferences for bank products and services;
  • Annual bonus scheme depending on the achieved results;
  • Preferential conditions for Multisport / CoolFit card;
  • Great location – in the heart of Sofia’s city center;
  • Discounts in various companies;
  • Refer a Friend Bonus.



If you are looking for a career where you can apply your passion for data, grow your skills, and contribute to the success of a leading bank, we would love to hear from you!


Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. All applications will be treated in confidentiality.

Title: Reporting Analyst
Description:
Job Summary: We are seeking a highly skilled and detail-oriented Reporting Analyst to join our Digital & IT team at IONWAY. The ideal candidate will be responsible for the end-to-end process to deliver business relevant reporting, starting with the requirements gathering through to the delivery of reports based on Microsoft PowerBI.




Key Responsibilities:

Critically analyze and challenge business requirements to understand the real needs.
Translate business needs into documented data models by identifying underlying systems and data fields.
Create visually powerful and insightful PowerBI reports.
Collaborate with the corporate IS team to define additional data pipelines when data is not available in the data lake.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity in all reports and data models.
Continuously improve reporting processes and methodologies.
Provide insights and recommendations based on data analysis to support business decision-making.




Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Business, Data Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Reporting Analyst or similar role.
Strong proficiency in PowerBI and data modelling.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.
Attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy.




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with data lakes and data pipeline development.
Familiarity with corporate IS systems and processes.
Advanced knowledge of SQL and other data manipulation languages.




What can you expect working with us:

Full-time job in a hybrid system (3 days in the office - 2 days in Wrocław, 1 day in Nysa, 2 days remote).
Flexible start hours (07:00-09:00).
Annual bonus.
Benefits package including: commuting cost reimbursement, life insurance, sports card - Medicover Sport, unlimited access to coffee and tea.
Access to private medical care (Luxmed) - cost covered by the employer.
Fully funded training for additional qualifications (possibility to learn selected foreign languages during work hours).
Active participation in creating the work environment in a newly established facility.
Values we take seriously: Collaboration / Operational Excellence / Respect / Responsibility / Positivity / Entrepreneurial Spirit.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join Helprise - one of the fastest growing outsourcing and consultancy firms providing the best talent, know-how and solutions for the execution of business processes. Be part of building an ecosystem that gives unique value to our customers, partners, candidates and employees. We are your career advocates - offering extraordinary opportunities to grow with us, by supporting top global brands in their development of business and technology services internationally.

As a Data Analyst, you will be part of a dynamic team specializing in HR and organizational data analysis. Your primary responsibilities will include data processing, conducting advanced statistical analyses, and delivering valuable business insights.

YOU WILL


Preparing and structuring data - Collecting, cleaning, and transforming raw data into a structured format for analysis
Conducting advanced statistical analyses - Performing regression modeling, time series analysis, and other quantitative methods to uncover trends and patterns
Creating reports and dashboards - Developing clear and concise visual presentations of data insights for business stakeholders
Identifying trends and providing insights - Supporting strategic decision-making through data-driven recommendations
Ensuring data accuracy and consistency - Monitoring data quality and troubleshooting inconsistencies to improve reporting reliability
Collaborating with project teams - Working closely with internal teams and clients to understand analytical needs and provide solutions



Requirements


A higher education degree (preferably in economics, business analytics, statistics, work psychology, or quantitative social sciences)
Minimum 4 years of experience in data analysis
Ability to independently conduct regression and time series analyses
Very good knowledge of Excel (including advanced formulas, pivot tables, and data visualization tools)
Proficiency in spoken and written English
Experience working with both structured and unstructured databases
Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Ability to communicate data-driven insights in a clear and compelling manner
Capability to work independently while also effectively collaborating with teams and clients
Proficiency in VBA, R, or Python programming - will be an asset.



Benefits


Flexible Work Arrangements - Adaptable schedules to support work-life balance
Contract Flexibility - Choose from various contract models, including employment contracts and B2B agreements
Sports Card Benefit - Access to a wide range of fitness and wellness facilities
Private Medical Care - Comprehensive, world-class healthcare services
Life Insurance - Financial security with a robust insurance plan
Employee Referral Program - Attractive rewards for successful candidate referrals

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Back in 1966, in Marseilles, when the world was talking about Start Trek 🚀, Sodexo was serving its first customers, initiating our journey in the Quality-of-Life Services leaded by the bold Pierre Bellon.




Since then, we continued our adventure of offering everyday need solutions, improving the life of our users across the globe 🌎 supported by more than 400 thousand dedicated and brave colleagues, in 64 countries, that lead us to where we are today.




🇵🇹 Portugal is no exception and 5 years ago, our shared service center – Sodexo Business Services – SBS, was born! In here, you will have the chance to be part of several 📊🧾Financial teams like Record to Report, Order to Cash, Purchase to Pay, Financial Analysis, Master Data, among others, that support European markets, making sure the business continues to growth.







💥 Are you bold enough to join our crew, with your unique character and ideas, and make us even bigger?




💼 We are waiting for you! And so, your career!




In the meantime, check the opportunity below:




Senior Data Analyst




This position is responsible for gathering, analyzing, and interpreting complex data to help drive strategic decisions and optimize business processes. The role involves transforming raw data into actionable insights, developing reports and dashboards, and supporting the organization in identifying trends and opportunities for growth.




⚙ What will you do?

Primary tasks:

Create, restructure, and manage large datasets, files, and systems.
Develop clear and actionable visualizations through Power BI dashboards.
Filter, clean, and validate data, ensuring data accuracy and implementing performance indicators to identify and correct issues.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex datasets with minimal guidance.
Present her/his findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise communication.




Secondary tasks:

Work closely with management to prioritize business and information needs.
Build stakeholder understanding of data usage and its impact on business decisions.
Apply business logic to guide analysis, synthesize findings, and deliver clear, actionable insights.
Follow standardized processes established by the Sodexo Data Factory.
Document data processing decisions and summarize data quality in technical memos.Support implementation of continuous improvement processes for stakeholders.
Continuously enhance technical skills and explore new technologies to stay current with industry advancements.




🤙 What you'll need to succeed?:

Bachelor’s degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, education, social sciences, or related fields required with two or more years of relevant work experience. Master’s degree preferred.
5/8 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar , with a record of analyzing large datasets and delivering actionable insights.
Strong experience in using business intelligence tools, especially Power BI for data visualization and reporting.
Proficient in data manipulation and query languages, particularly SQL.
Strong knowledge of DBT, Databricks, or other data transformation & pipeline tools.
Proven ability to translate business needs into data models and analytics solutions.
Prior experience working in a data-driven environment and contributing to decision-making through analytics
Strong analytical skills with attention to detail and accuracy.
Strong problem-solving abilities with the capacity to approach complex data challenges methodically.
Excellent communication skills to explain data insights and their business impact to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks while maintaining clear focus on business outcomes.
A proactive mindset with a passion for continuous learning and staying updated on new technologies and methodologies.




🎉 What we have to offer you?

Hybrid working model;
Flexible working hours;
Health & Life Insurance;
Attractive Meal allowance paid in Meal Card;
Additional Days off: extra vacation day, employee’s birthday, volunteering day;
More than 6000 free online courses;
Opportunity to grow professionally inside the Company;
Possibility to participate in multicultural projects;
Several internal activities aiming to promote our team´s wellbeing.




We are waiting for you!




Send us your CV to our email Recruitment.SBS.Portugal@sodexo.com with the title of the role on the subject and check all the opportunities on our career website (https://www.sodexo.com/en/contact-us/sbs-porto/porto-jobs)




Find out more about Sodexo: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XX7PoE9kazU




Sodexo is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

At Sodexo we believe in Privacy and your Privacy is very important to us that´s why your personal data will only be used for the purpose of managing our recruitment process, will be processed in accordance to the GDPR and treated confidentially. For further information about how we process your personal data please reach out to privacy.sbs@sodexo.com.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Us:

LTIMindtree is a global technology consulting and digital solutions company that enables enterprises across industries to reimagine business models, accelerate innovation, and maximize growth by harnessing digital technologies. As a digital transformation partner to more than 700+ clients, LTIMindtree brings extensive domain and technology expertise to help drive superior competitive differentiation, customer experiences, and business outcomes in a converging world. Powered by nearly 90,000 talented and entrepreneurial professionals across more than 30 countries, LTIMindtree — a Larsen & Toubro Group company — combines the industry-acclaimed strengths of erstwhile Larsen and Toubro Infotech and Mindtree in solving the most complex business challenges and delivering transformation at scale. For more information, please visit www.ltimindtree.com.




We are hiring Data Analyst in Stockholm, Sweden with below expertise:




Minimum 8 10 years of IT experience and minimum 3 4 years of Analyst experience overall 5 years of Data Analyst experience
Advanced Business Analyst who has profound experience in doing data Analysis using SQL Knowing SAS Python is an added advantage
Well versed and comfortable in handling Huge Datasets
Good Analytical and problem-solving skills
Should be able to understand the Business terminologies and act as a very good barrier between Business and IT development team
Added advantage to have Functional background around Credit Risk
Independently Convert the Business requirements into High level and low level Solution design
Should be able to support in UT ST and end to end UAT testing
Good Analytical and problem solving skills
Added advantage in creating functional test cases and validating the results
It is very important to have good communication skills and an agile team player




Mandatory Skills : MS Excel, PowerBI, Python, QlikView, Tableau

Good to Have Skills : ANSI-SQL

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
ICAP CRIF (previously ICAP S.A. group of companies), with 60 years of successful presence in Greece, Romania, Bulgaria and Cyprus, is the market leader in Credit Risk & Business Information Solutions in Southeastern Europe.




Would you like to join ICAP CRIF and build your career in a multinational leading company?




We are looking for a talented and passionate Data Analyst to join our dynamic team in Bulgaria. Our team provides clients with Business Information services through different types of products, responding to their needs of evaluating their clients’ commercial risk.







Main responsibilities:

Ensuring the completeness of the data in our database by accessing our sources and adding, when necessary, the newly published details.
Checking and verifying the completeness and accuracy of the information in the products created.
Adjusting the risk assessment result with qualitative data for certain types of products.







Required Qualifications / Skills:

Degree in Economic Studies, Finance, Accounting or relevant field
2+ years of working experience in a related field
Tech literacy (MS Office - Excel, Word) and competence in reporting
Excellent knowledge of English and fluency in written and spoken language
Ease of communication
Focus on detail and ability to deliver respecting the deadlines
Customer centricity
Team Spirit




The Company offers:

Competitive remuneration package including annual performance bonus
Private insurance scheme
Benefits scheme
Flexibility to work from home some days per week
A modern, dynamic and innovation-driven working environment
Opportunities to cooperate and exchange ideas with all countries of the CRIF world
Continuous personal development opportunities with personalized in class and on the job trainings
Great career prospects in a fast-growing multi-national organization




All information received will be treated with strict confidentiality.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
💼 Job Title: Data Analyst

📍 Location: Belgium, Hybrid

📝 Contract Type: Freelance

⏳ Contract Duration: 6 months +

💰 Daily Rate: Competitive, based on experience




What You’ll Do:

Analyse large datasets to identify patterns and insights
Build dashboards and reports to track key business metrics
Work with teams to improve decision-making using data-driven insights
Clean, structure, and optimize datasets for efficiency
Use statistical methods to test hypotheses and forecast trends




What You’ll Need:

Technical Skills:

Proficiency in SQL (querying, joins, optimization)
Strong skills in Python/R for data analysis
Experience with BI tools (Tableau, Power BI, Looker)
Knowledge of Excel (advanced functions, pivot tables, VBA is a plus)
Familiarity with data warehousing and ETL processes
Understanding of statistics, A/B testing, and predictive modelling

Soft Skills:

Analytical mindset with attention to detail
Problem-solving approach to messy data
Strong communication skills to translate insights into action







Sodarec is an equal opportunity recruiter. All applications are considered based on skills and experience, without discrimination. While we appreciate every application, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill was founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company and their main mission is to delivery value through the knowledge. We enable companies to meet the chalenges of digital world by providing our clients with business models that ensure technological capacity, flexibility and agility. We are more than 500 consultants with offices in Lisbon, Porto and Madrid.




DECSKILL operates in 3 main areas:

DECSKILL TALENT, through which we provide our clients with an extension to their IT teams;




DECSKILL BOOST, through which we provide our client with software development models to increase capacity and optimize Time-to-Market, where we create and manage teams that deliver according to their needs, at the desired speed;




DECSKILL CONNECT through which we provide our client with consulting services, as well as the implementation and management of information technology infrastructures.




Our practice results in the creation of value for our customers, either by delivering qualified and value-added services, or through highly qualified and motivated professionals, as well as technology solutions that allow us to operate and transform the business of our customers.




We are looking for an Data Analyst!




Responsabilities:

To be part of an international and diverse team who helps Global Markets Front Office to get to know their clients better and identify opportunities and trends through what data can tell.
As a Data Analyst, you will play a vital role in our team. Working directly with one or more of the bank's business areas, you will provide valuable insights to drive business growth, understanding their needs, proposing and implementing data-driven solutions (analysis, visualization and automation). You will exercise a lot of problem identification and problem solving.
You will have the opportunity to take ownership of business essential analytical projects that involve retrieving, preparing and analysing complex datasets using data/statistical models and best practices in data visualization for the reporting creation, with the goal to produce insights and automated tools that will guide strategic.
You will move between technical and non-technical areas and should be able to communicate well with different types of professionals. It is very important to be able to clearly and concisely understand stakeholder’s’ needs and translate these to our technical team, as well as present the results of complex analysis.
You will move between technical and non-technical areas and should be able to communicate well with different types of professionals. It is very important to be able to clearly and concisely understand stakeholder’s’ needs and translate these to our technical team, as well as present the results of complex analysis.




Requirements:

Academic background in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics or related fields
Experience in any data visualization tool such as Tableau or Power BI
Experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas)
Proficiency in SQL
Knowledge of descriptive statistics and hypothesis testing is a plus
Knowledge in Big Data technology such as Pyspark, Presto and Airflow is a plus
Knowledge of Power Query and DAX is a plus
Strong teamwork and communication skills.
Autonomy and ownership of projects.
Passion for international projects and open to occasional travel.
Willingness to mentor and guide junior team members.
Proficiency in English (both spoken and written).
Problem solver mindset.
Strong leadership skills.
Availability to travel (short-term periods).
Be driven, enthusiastic and dynamic in search of improving processes, controls & procedure.
Be pro-active, enthusiastic and able to work well in a team.
Fluent in English.




If you’re interested in this job, please send your CV to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com with reference “CA/DataAnalyst”.




Thank You! 😊




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Junior Data Analyst – Unique Opportunity!
Description:
Junior Data Analyst – Unique Opportunity!




Impactful projects from day one
Accelerate your career
Data-driven decision-making




Join a well-established, Irish-owned company that invests in its people for the long term! As a Junior Data Analyst, you will be hands-on from the very first day, working with large datasets across multiple business functions to provide critical insights that shape the company's strategy.




This is a rare opportunity to follow end-to-end workflows, gaining a deep understanding of how data drives business success while developing expertise in SQL, Power BI, Tableau, and Machine Learning.




If you're looking for a broad, hands-on role where you can work across multiple domains, integrate AI-driven insights, and develop into an independent and vital component of the organization, this is the perfect opportunity for you!




You will:

Work with complex datasets to improve business efficiency and decision-making.
Gain exposure to end-to-end workflows, understanding how data supports key business functions.
Master industry-leading visualization tools – Power BI, Tableau, and Excel.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, delivering insights to key stakeholders.
Develop into a self-sufficient data expert, playing a crucial role in business success




Skills/Experience:

1–3 years of experience in Data Analysis or a related field
Proficiency in SQL, Python, Power BI, and Tableau
Strong communication and problem-solving skills.




Salary / Remuneration:

€25.000 - €40.000

Pension scheme, Online health support, salary protection, and many more!




For more information contact Joana Mota confidentially at +353 1 649 8532 or email your CV to joana.mota@archer.ie

I specialize in recruiting for Data Analyst, if you wish to discuss this or other opportunities, please feel free to contact me.




For more opportunities, visit: https://www.archer.ie/candidates/

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Procuras dar um passo na tua carreira nas áreas de IT e Telecomunicações? Então chegaste ao sítio certo – à Smart!




A tecnologia, a transformação e a inovação fazem parte do nosso ADN. Somos uma empresa de consultoria tecnológica com mais de uma década de experiência no desenvolvimento de projetos nacionais e internacionais em IT e Telecomunicações e queremos fazer parte da tua história.




O que precisas para ser um Junior Data Analyst?




Conhecimento a nível avançado de SQL e PowerBI
Capacidade para trabalhar em Python é fator de valorização
1 a 3 anos de experiência em desenvolvimento de dashboards, KPIs e ETL
Formação em Business Intelligence, Data Analytics ou área similar é fator preferencial

Quais serão as tuas funções na SMART?




Desenvolvimento de dashboards, KPIs e ETL no âmbito de vendas a clientes residenciais
Acompanhamento e otimização de processamento de dados
Identificação de oportunidades de melhoria em todos os indicadores, relatórios e processos
Comunicação e negociação com os canais comerciais, equipas de suporte e outras áreas da empresa
Análises de dados e de negócio







Porquê ser SMART?




Tornamos reais os projetos em que participamos.
Amamos o que fazemos e temos orgulho no resultado do nosso trabalho.
Somos simples e eficientes.
Valorizamos as nossas pessoas.
Somos uma equipa dinâmica, íntegra e de confiança.




Onde podes ser SMART?

• Lisboa




Consideramos profissionais que se encontrem no Brasil e tenham disponibilidade para mudar-se para Portugal – asseguramos todo o processo de visto.




Tens um perfil SMART?

Title: Data Analyst - Power BI
Description:
¿Te gustaría formar parte de un equipo dinámico y con oportunidades de desarrollo profesional? 🚀




Si buscas un cambio laboral y te interesan los proyectos innovadores de ámbito internacional, ¡tenemos una oferta para ti!




En NTT Data, somos más de 150,000 profesionales distribuidos en 50 países, especializados en diversos sectores como telecomunicaciones, finanzas, industria, utilities, sector público y sanidad. 🌍




Nuestra misión es ofrecer soluciones tecnológicas, de negocio, y consultoría, a través de la innovación y la colaboración en equipos multidisciplinares. ¡Ser parte de nuestro equipo te permitirá estar a la vanguardia tecnológica y romper paradigmas!




En NTT Data Centers GDNe, seguimos creciendo y buscamos un Experto/a en Power BI. Buscamos profesionales apasionados que puedan crecer con nosotros en entornos de gran envergadura, contando con un plan de formación continua y mucha flexibilidad.




Requisitos mínimos:

👩‍🎓 Grado en Ingeniería Informática/Telecomunicaciones, Grado Superior o similar

📊 Más de 3 años de experiencia con Power BI

💼 Experiencia liderando proyectos y equipos de trabajo

🌟 Buen nivel de inglés (mínimo B2)

🤖 Conocimiento profundo en análisis de datos y visualización avanzada




Te ofrecemos:

📜 Contrato estable: indefinido a jornada completa

🤝 Beneficios sociales (flexibilidad horaria, seguro médico para ti y tu familia...)

📈 Autonomía para gestionar el trabajo, plan de carrera y formación para fomentar tu crecimiento personal

🏡 Teletrabajo 100% o adaptado a tus necesidades




En NTT DATA, creemos en la diversidad y la inclusión, donde cada persona aporta una perspectiva única e invaluable. Nuestro entorno potencia el respeto a la creatividad y las oportunidades equitativas para el desarrollo profesional.




Apúntate y forma parte de una de las mayores compañías de IT del mundo. ¡Te estamos esperando! 😉

Title: Data Analyst (Data&Analytics, Freshful Team)
HTML:
We’re always looking for the ones truly passionate about their work. If you are amongst them, you can rest assured there is a place for you in eMAG. We’ve grown very fast and are determined to keep doing so. What brought us here is our desire for continuous evolution and practical results.


More than 6000 colleagues are part of eMAG Teams. We strongly believe in people's development and therefore every year we invest more and more energy and resources to remain an organization that is constantly learning. We want to ensure that you’ll have the most talented colleagues and the proper environment to grow and achieve great results, to become what you desire on a personal and professional level. Join us, grow faster!



As a Data Analyst, you will work closely with stakeholders across the organization to understand their data needs and provide them with relevant insights and recommendations to support business decisions and goals.



What you’ll have to do:

  • Gather and aggregate relevant data from various sources, such as internal Databases, Google Analytics and BigQuery, Business Intelligence resources;
  • Analyze complex user datasets using data visualization and statistical tools;
  • Analyze user behavior data to identify patterns, preferences, and potential areas for improvement;
  • Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to visualize and communicate insights effectively to stakeholders;
  • Collaborate with data engineering teams to ensure data integrity, quality, and accessibility for analysis purposes;
  • Stay updated with industry best practices and emerging trends in e-commerce analytics and user behavior analysis.


What makes you a good fit:

  • Have 1+ years experience as a Data Analyst or similar positions;
  • Have SQL experience;
  • Have experience with at least one data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI);
  • Have strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to work with complex datasets;
  • Able to translate business problems into quantitative analyses and produce useful insights;
  • Have excellent communication skills to present findings and collaborate effectively with teams;
  • Able to work independently;
  • Excellent English communication skills (spoken and written).


What makes you stand out:

  • Have strong understanding of e-commerce KPIs and user behavior analysis methodologies;
  • Knowledge of Pyhton;
  • Experience of working within structured and Agile project environments;
  • University degree in Economics, Computer Science, or equivalent professional experience.


What we’ve prepared for you:

  • Medical subscription: Medicover, MedLife or Regina Maria.
  • A flexible budget that you can invest in yourself as you wish: meal tickets, holiday tickets, cultural vouchers, private pension, foreign language classes, eMAG, Fashion Days, Tazz, Therme & Genius, membership to different gyms or even professional development classes.
  • Different discounts from our partners: banking, mobile, dental medicine or wellness.
  • Access to the Bookster library and free credits on the Hilio psycho-emotional health platform.
  • An accelerated learning environment, with access to over 100.000 curated online resources and platforms, learning academies and development programs.
  • New headquarters, where sleek design, natural light, and versatile spaces create an energizing and comfortable environment for hybrid work.


Curious to find out more about the next step in your career? Apply now and if your experience is relevant for the role you wish, we will give you a call for more details!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
As a data analyst you will be supporting the Journey Decisioning team that resides in the Personalization product area. This team focuses on recommending the most relevant next step for a visitor at the current moment, given all that we know about them. That unfolds into 2 separate products/components, one that focuses on personalised lay-outs (which components do we show to customers - and in which order), and one that focuses on journey guidance (what is the most relevant message to show customers in this moment of the journey). The first product is being tested in several of our markets and we're working to extend this into more markets, potentially with more iterations, and to other page types (e.g. Product Pages) and channels (e.g. App). The second product is in its design stage and we aim to launch this later in the year.




The scope of the consultant services is to assist




The majority of your work will be done within the Journey Decisioning team. Most of the digital teams atwork in a PEDX (Product, Engineering, Data, eXperience) structure. Next to that you will join a team of peers (data analysts) who work with other teams in the Personalisation product area and the front-end products. his set-up ensures you always have colleagues to think with, learn from, and educate on what you're doing within the Journey Decisioning team.




Requirements:




Must: analytical skills, SQL, good stakeholder management, knowledge/experience on personalisation (e.g. recommender systems, clustering / segmentation, modelling techniques for prediction), knowledge/experience on customer journeys
Nice: experience with GCP, BigQuery, Python (Notebooks), familiar in an FMCG of retail sector, eager to learn, familiar in an eCommerce environment, experience with companies that have both an online and offline sales channel




What 3 things from above are most important?




Analytical skills, knowledge/experience on customer journeys, knowledge/experience on personalisation
Show more
HTML:
As a data analyst you will be supporting the Journey Decisioning team that resides in the Personalization product area. This team focuses on recommending the most relevant next step for a visitor at the current moment, given all that we know about them. That unfolds into 2 separate products/components, one that focuses on personalised lay-outs (which components do we show to customers - and in which order), and one that focuses on journey guidance (what is the most relevant message to show customers in this moment of the journey). The first product is being tested in several of our markets and we're working to extend this into more markets, potentially with more iterations, and to other page types (e.g. Product Pages) and channels (e.g. App). The second product is in its design stage and we aim to launch this later in the year.


The scope of the consultant services is to assist


  • The majority of your work will be done within the Journey Decisioning team. Most of the digital teams atwork in a PEDX (Product, Engineering, Data, eXperience) structure. Next to that you will join a team of peers (data analysts) who work with other teams in the Personalisation product area and the front-end products. his set-up ensures you always have colleagues to think with, learn from, and educate on what you're doing within the Journey Decisioning team.


Requirements:


  • Must: analytical skills, SQL, good stakeholder management, knowledge/experience on personalisation (e.g. recommender systems, clustering / segmentation, modelling techniques for prediction), knowledge/experience on customer journeys
  • Nice: experience with GCP, BigQuery, Python (Notebooks), familiar in an FMCG of retail sector, eager to learn, familiar in an eCommerce environment, experience with companies that have both an online and offline sales channel


What 3 things from above are most important?


  • Analytical skills, knowledge/experience on customer journeys, knowledge/experience on personalisation

Title: Data Analyst (PowerBI)
Description:
Who are we:

Neotalent Conclusion is one of the leading Iberian specialists providing services in Information Technology and Engineering services. As part of the Netherlands-based organization Conclusion, which has an ecosystem of over 25 companies and 3,600 employees, we are focused on increasing the technological capacity of our clients and the digital transformation of their application ecosystems.

We are talent specialists, attracting the best people and combining them with the needs of the most ambitious projects, at the right time. Our success comes from our investments in innovation, our focus on results, and, above all, the guarantee that our people will have happy and rewarding careers.

With over 25 years of solid experience, Neotalent Conclusion has established its presence in key locations, including Lisbon, Porto, and Madrid. The company currently has more than 950 professionals in the different areas in which it operates.




Neotalent, the responsive people.




Find out more about us at www.neotalent.pt.




Role Overview:

We are looking for a Data Analyst (PowerBI) to join one of our biggest clients in the Porto area (Hybrid). A multinational financial services firm, one of the largest financial groups and among the 30 largest financial institution’s globally.




What you will do:

Create and update PowerBI Dashboards
Collect data (internal & external) and investigate their business value through data analysis and visualization
Create and adapt data analysis models and tools
Mount, execute and automate ETL processes for extracting data (with python and SQL) to serve analytical needs
Develop & improve data quality controls and standardize processes and analyses
Use previous experience in marketing topics to translate business needs
Collect and visualize KPIs on the performance of our in-house models
Basic knowledge of data python packages




What you are like:

At least 4 years of experience as a Data Analyst;
Experience with PowerBI;
Strong understanding of Agile methodologies and frameworks, particularly Scrum;
Excellent communication skills - English;




Why join us

Work on challenging projects for big clients
Learn more about emerging technologies
Possibility of working remotely
Design your career plan
Access to continuous training and certifications
Evolve through our internal mobility program
… and much more!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a Data Analyst seeking a new interesting challenge? 🔍

If your answer is yes, it’s your lucky day so keep reading, it can be just what you're looking for! 👀




✍️WHAT WILL YOU DO?

We are looking for a dynamic, proactive and talented person to join our team and perform the following tasks:

• Working with stakeholders to understand the business problem they're trying to solve and the as-is landscape.

• Collaborating with others and analyzing large unstructured, previously unseen datasets to source and build understanding of relevant data.

• Building advanced SQL scripts to connect data from across our data lake to analyze and validate data mappings.

• Identifying data anomalies and data quality issues and ensuring these are handled or flagged appropriately.

• Choosing and deploying appropriate analytical and statistical techniques to understand issues, identify trends and forecast performance.

• Working with architecture and technical (engineering) teams where required to develop robust, automated solutions for regular data and insights needs.

• Working in an agile manner, ensuring the outputs required are in line with stakeholder expectations and delivered on-time.

• Developing outputs to summarize analytical findings clearly for stakeholders

• Interacting with various levels within the organization, from entry level team members to senior management.




🧐 WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

• Years' experience: minimum 5 years in a similar role

• Fluent English

• Experience of translating business problems into data solutions, adopting the most appropriate tools and techniques for the job.

• Good understanding of financial services business concepts and key metrics.

• Knowledge of mathematical and statistical concepts and when to apply these.

• Identifies research and reports on beneficial data usage opportunities in different departments or environments.

• Strong analytical skills including:

1. Ability to provide observations and comment.

2. Wider-thinking and problem solving – identifying and delivering reporting through own initiative.

3. Utilizing the data to build out a compelling narrative for stakeholders.

4. Understanding of the change management process.




📅 WHERE AND WHEN?

Workplace: Remote (Candidate should live in Spain)
Work Schedule: Business Hours




🤝 WHAT CAN WE OFFER YOU?

Permanent contract 📋 - We offer indefinite contracts from the first day.
Pay and benefits 💸 - Competitive salary and a flexible compensation plan adapted to your needs (Ticket restaurant plan, Childcare Ticket, Transport Ticket and Health Insurance).
Work from home 🏚️ - We offer you a financial support every month for your working from home expenses. In addition, in the first month we will give you a bonus to help you to set up your workplace👨‍💻
Opportunity knocks 👍🏻 - Being a part of a growing company, we want to support your path with a career development plan and annual performance-based compensation reviews.
Learn as you grow 📚 - Starting with a fantastic onboarding program, TCS has robust learning platforms that will allow you to learn and grow personal as professionally.
Bring your buddy 👫 - If you have referred a friend for an open position under the BYB Scheme and she/he is hired you’ll receive a very attractive cash award.
Connect globally 🌏 - Work with people from all over the world. You can feel the multicultural workforce.
Benefit from being a TCSer 🎟️ – By being part of the TCS Spain family you can enjoy benefits, offers and corporate discounts on the best brands.
And so on 🎉 - Appreciations, incentives, Team Building activities, diversity and inclusion programs, sustainability activities, corporative events... This has only just begun!




💡WHO ARE WE?

Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is an Information Technology (IT) company founded in 1968 as part of the Indian Tata Group and is one of the top 3 technology companies globally 🚀




With a presence in 55 countries and more than 600,000 employees, TCS is considered one of the 10 best companies to work for worldwide in 2024 according to the Top Employers Institute 🥇




TCS Spain started operations in 2001 and currently has a diverse workforce that collaborates with the main Spanish and multinational companies 🌏




TCS Spain has been certified as a Top Employer 2024 and has also been chosen as one of the 100 Best Companies to Work for in Spain in 2024 according to Forbes🏆




Among the portfolio of services, TCS has information technology services, asset-based solutions, global consulting, engineering and industrial services, digital solutions and services, application maintenance and development, quality assurance and testing services, IT infrastructure and BPS 🎯




Responsible for development, TCS Spain is committed to inclusion, diversity and sustainability, and promotes flexibility policies that support wellbeing and work-life balance 💯




WELCOME, WE ARE WAITING FOR YOU! 🚀

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Emma Villas, tour operator italiano leader a livello internazionale nel settore degli affitti turistici di ville e casali in Italia, cerca un candidato da inquadrare come Process and Data Analyst, da inserire all’interno dell’organico aziendale.




Il candidato dovrà occuparsi di:




- Analizzare grandi volumi di dati per identificare tendenze, modelli e opportunità.

- Creare report e dashboard che forniscano informazioni chiare e utili.

- Collaborare con diversi dipartimenti per supportare le decisioni basate sui dati.

- Migliorare i processi di raccolta e analisi dei dati.

- Analizzare ed aggregare dati al fine dello studio di un determinato prodotto o segmento di mercato e consentire all’azienda di sviluppare e/o migliorare i propri modelli di business in modo prospettico.

- Presentare i risultati delle analisi a diverse audience, rendendo le informazioni accessibili e comprensibili.

I requisiti richiesti sono:

- Laurea in Statistica, Informatica, Economia, Matematica, Economia, Ingegneria Gestionaleo campo correlato.

- Esperienza pregressa come Data Analyst o in una posizione simile.

- Conoscenza avanzata di Excel e strumenti di analisi dati (es. Access, SQL, Python, R).

- Capacità di visualizzazione dei dati con strumenti come Tableau o Power BI.

- Eccellenti capacità di problem-solving e pensiero critico.

- Ottime capacità di comunicazione scritta e verbale.

- Conoscenza della lingua inglese.




Sede di lavoro: Chiusi (Si)

Orario: full time

Disponibilità: da subito




Il presente annuncio è rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91 e a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità, ai sensi dei decreti legislativi 215/03 e 216/03.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
💼 Job Title: Data Analyst

📍 Location: Belgium, Hybrid

📝 Contract Type: Freelance

⏳ Contract Duration: 6 months +

💰 Daily Rate: Competitive, based on experience




What You’ll Do:

Analyse large datasets to identify patterns and insights
Build dashboards and reports to track key business metrics
Work with teams to improve decision-making using data-driven insights
Clean, structure, and optimize datasets for efficiency
Use statistical methods to test hypotheses and forecast trends




What You’ll Need:

Technical Skills:

Proficiency in SQL (querying, joins, optimization)
Strong skills in Python/R for data analysis
Experience with BI tools (Tableau, Power BI, Looker)
Knowledge of Excel (advanced functions, pivot tables, VBA is a plus)
Familiarity with data warehousing and ETL processes
Understanding of statistics, A/B testing, and predictive modelling

Soft Skills:

Analytical mindset with attention to detail
Problem-solving approach to messy data
Strong communication skills to translate insights into action







Sodarec is an equal opportunity recruiter. All applications are considered based on skills and experience, without discrimination. While we appreciate every application, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
