Title: BI Analyst
Description:
Job Description

ABOUT THIS JOB

Flexibility. Fun. Freedom to grow. It’s all happening at NielsenIQ. This is a great opportunity for individuals aiming at building and developing a career in the world of Finance/BI. Our accurate, detail-oriented Financial Analysts/BI Specialists roll up their sleeves to provide analytical support for special projects, ad-hoc reviews and other communication to internal stakeholders. They also gain global experience in an engaging, multicultural work environment.

Responsibilities


Data Analysis:
Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can drive business decisions
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and interpret data requirements
Reporting and Dashboards:
Develop and maintain reports and dashboards using BI tools (eg. PowerBI)
Provide regular, accurate, and actionable insights to stakeholders
Data Visualization:
Create visually appealing and understandable data visualizations to communicate complex information effectively
Ensure that data visualizations align with business objectives and user requirements
Data Cleaning and Transformation:
Clean and preprocess raw data for analysis, ensuring data accuracy and consistency
Transform and structure data to meet the needs of various business units
Collaboration:
Work closely with business users and the Global Financial Planning and Analysis Team to understand their needs and requirements
Collaborate with the Development team to ensure data integrity and availability
Support/Coach junior members of the team in projects/developments
Continuous Learning:
Stay updated on industry trends, BI tools, and best practices
Participate in training and professional development opportunities to enhance skills


a Little Bit About You

You’re looking for a career with room to grow. You’re an ambitious and open-minded individual who is eager to learn. What is more, you have that passion and drive to develop your career within a truly international environment. You have a love relationship with BI tools and Excel spreadsheets. You’re not afraid to engage in discussion with IT-oriented colleagues. With your critical and analytical thinking abilities, you can create opportunities to better our business. You’re ready to break ground on what’s next.

Qualifications


Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Finance, Accounting, IT, Data Science or equivalent degree
Around 1.5 - 3 year of experience in financial and/or business intelligence positions
Able to work as part of a team in a multicultural environment
Knowledge of BI tools (e.g. Microsoft PowerBI)
Knowledge of SQL (e.g. PostgreSQL)
Advanced usage of MS Excel (VBA would be an asset)
Knowledge of OneStream / HFM / SAP would be a plus
Knowledge of ETL tools (e.g. Azure Data Factory, Alteryx) would be a plus
Fluent in English, both speaking and writing
Ability to interact with various stakeholders, incl. senior leaders
Ability to carry out tasks independently and support/coach junior members of the team


WE OFFER


Benefit package: Multisport card, private medical coverage Medicover, life insurance, Benefit platform allowing to purchase cinema and theatre tickets
Additional days off and recognition of special moments in your life
Stable working environment with employment contract
A possibility to create individual career paths, additional training
A possibility to engage in charity actions and participation in numerous social activities organised within the company
Modern office in a great location
Work in a mixed system: part of the week you work from home (home office), a part from the office. Therefore we provide all the necessary equipment to perform your duties from home
Mentoring - Mentee Program
Volunteer time off (global volunteer day)
Internal Recognition Program
Free LinkedIn Learning access that helps you discover and develop business, technology-related, and creative skills through over 20,000 courses available in 7 languages)
Free Employee Assistance Programs (EAP) - NIQ offers support to all associates and their families for their emotional well-being trough professional, timely and confidential counselling services on issues related to everyday concerns & problems, overcome emotional challenges, and maintain a healthy and balanced lifestyle


Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill was founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company and their main mission is to delivery value through the knowledge. We enable companies to meet the chalenges of digital world by providing our clients with business models that ensure technological capacity, flexibility and agility. We are more than 500 consultants with offices in Lisbon, Porto and Madrid.




DECSKILL operates in 3 main areas:

DECSKILL TALENT, through which we provide our clients with an extension to their IT teams;




DECSKILL BOOST, through which we provide our client with software development models to increase capacity and optimize Time-to-Market, where we create and manage teams that deliver according to their needs, at the desired speed;




DECSKILL CONNECT through which we provide our client with consulting services, as well as the implementation and management of information technology infrastructures.




Our practice results in the creation of value for our customers, either by delivering qualified and value-added services, or through highly qualified and motivated professionals, as well as technology solutions that allow us to operate and transform the business of our customers.




We are looking for an Data Analyst!




Responsabilities:

To be part of an international and diverse team who helps Global Markets Front Office to get to know their clients better and identify opportunities and trends through what data can tell.
As a Data Analyst, you will play a vital role in our team. Working directly with one or more of the bank's business areas, you will provide valuable insights to drive business growth, understanding their needs, proposing and implementing data-driven solutions (analysis, visualization and automation). You will exercise a lot of problem identification and problem solving.
You will have the opportunity to take ownership of business essential analytical projects that involve retrieving, preparing and analysing complex datasets using data/statistical models and best practices in data visualization for the reporting creation, with the goal to produce insights and automated tools that will guide strategic.
You will move between technical and non-technical areas and should be able to communicate well with different types of professionals. It is very important to be able to clearly and concisely understand stakeholder’s’ needs and translate these to our technical team, as well as present the results of complex analysis.
You will move between technical and non-technical areas and should be able to communicate well with different types of professionals. It is very important to be able to clearly and concisely understand stakeholder’s’ needs and translate these to our technical team, as well as present the results of complex analysis.




Requirements:

Academic background in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics or related fields
Experience in any data visualization tool such as Tableau or Power BI
Experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas)
Proficiency in SQL
Knowledge of descriptive statistics and hypothesis testing is a plus
Knowledge in Big Data technology such as Pyspark, Presto and Airflow is a plus
Knowledge of Power Query and DAX is a plus
Strong teamwork and communication skills.
Autonomy and ownership of projects.
Passion for international projects and open to occasional travel.
Willingness to mentor and guide junior team members.
Proficiency in English (both spoken and written).
Problem solver mindset.
Strong leadership skills.
Availability to travel (short-term periods).
Be driven, enthusiastic and dynamic in search of improving processes, controls & procedure.
Be pro-active, enthusiastic and able to work well in a team.
Fluent in English.




If you’re interested in this job, please send your CV to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com with reference “CA/DataAnalyst”.




Thank You! 😊




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Junior Data Analyst – Unique Opportunity!
Description:
Junior Data Analyst – Unique Opportunity!




Impactful projects from day one
Accelerate your career
Data-driven decision-making




Join a well-established, Irish-owned company that invests in its people for the long term! As a Junior Data Analyst, you will be hands-on from the very first day, working with large datasets across multiple business functions to provide critical insights that shape the company's strategy.




This is a rare opportunity to follow end-to-end workflows, gaining a deep understanding of how data drives business success while developing expertise in SQL, Power BI, Tableau, and Machine Learning.




If you're looking for a broad, hands-on role where you can work across multiple domains, integrate AI-driven insights, and develop into an independent and vital component of the organization, this is the perfect opportunity for you!




You will:

Work with complex datasets to improve business efficiency and decision-making.
Gain exposure to end-to-end workflows, understanding how data supports key business functions.
Master industry-leading visualization tools – Power BI, Tableau, and Excel.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, delivering insights to key stakeholders.
Develop into a self-sufficient data expert, playing a crucial role in business success




Skills/Experience:

1–3 years of experience in Data Analysis or a related field
Proficiency in SQL, Python, Power BI, and Tableau
Strong communication and problem-solving skills.




Salary / Remuneration:

€25.000 - €40.000

Pension scheme, Online health support, salary protection, and many more!




For more information contact Joana Mota confidentially at +353 1 649 8532 or email your CV to joana.mota@archer.ie

I specialize in recruiting for Data Analyst, if you wish to discuss this or other opportunities, please feel free to contact me.




For more opportunities, visit: https://www.archer.ie/candidates/

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst – Drive Sustainability with Data (Immediate Consideration)




📍 Remote | Work from Anywhere (UK Time Zone)

💰 Salary: £40,000 - £55,000 (Up to £70,000 for Lead Role)

🛂 Visa Sponsorship Available

📈 Career Growth – Opportunities for Progression in a High-Impact Industry

🌍 Make a Difference – Use Data to Tackle Climate Challenges




Are you passionate about using data to solve real-world problems? Do you want to contribute to a greener future while working in a fast-paced, forward-thinking environment? We’re a mission-driven sustainability company using technology and data to create a cleaner, more sustainable world. Now, we’re looking for a Data Analyst to join our team and help shape the future of sustainability.




What You’ll Do

Analyse large and complex datasets to identify trends in carbon emissions, renewable energy, waste reduction, and sustainability initiatives.
Develop insightful dashboards and reports to help businesses and policymakers make data-driven environmental decisions.
Work closely with sustainability experts, engineers, and product teams to turn data into actionable insights.
Design and refine predictive models to assess environmental impact and forecast sustainability outcomes.
Ensure data accuracy, quality, and integrity, helping build reliable climate impact metrics.
Stay up to date with industry trends and contribute ideas to improve sustainability strategies.




What We’re Looking For

Strong analytical skills with experience in SQL, Python, R, or similar tools.
Proficiency in data visualisation platforms such as Power BI, Tableau, or Looker.
Understanding of statistical methods and predictive modelling.
Passion for sustainability and an interest in climate data, energy systems, or ESG reporting.
Ability to translate complex datasets into clear, actionable insights for both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Previous experience in data analysis, sustainability, or a related field (preferred but not required).




Why Join?

🌍 Mission-Driven Work – Contribute to real, measurable environmental change.

💼 100% Remote & Flexible – Work from anywhere while following UK time zones.

📈 Career Growth – Be part of a company at the cutting edge of sustainable innovation.

🎓 Learning & Development – Access training, certifications, and mentorship opportunities.

🛂 Visa Sponsorship Available – We welcome global talent to drive our mission forward.

🏝 Generous Holiday Allowance – Enjoy a proper work-life balance with up to 38 days of paid leave.

❤️ Wellness & Mental Health Support – We prioritise your well-being.




This isn’t just another data role—it’s a chance to make a real impact in the fight against climate change. If you're passionate about sustainability and thrive in a data-driven environment, we’d love to hear from you.




Apply now – Let’s build a greener future together! 🌱

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: Data Analyst

Seniority: 3+ years

Location : Hybrid- Lisbon




Skills Needed?




Bachelor / Master in Computer Engineering or similar;
3+ years of experience in data analysis;
Strong proficiency in SQL for querying and data extraction;
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Looker);
Experience working with python;
Familiarity with databases such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, or Snowflake;
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills,
Good level of English and Portuguese;
Good level of french is a plus;
The candidate has to be in Portugal.







Why should you become part of our family?




You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote!







Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.We believe transparency, trust and integrity are the pillars of any business and relationship and that is what we promise our clients and employees who join our company KCS IT.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Procuras dar um passo na tua carreira nas áreas de IT e Telecomunicações?




Então chegaste ao sítio certo – à Smart!

A tecnologia, a transformação e a inovação fazem parte do nosso ADN. Somos uma empresa de consultoria tecnológica com mais de uma década de experiência no desenvolvimento de projetos nacionais e internacionais em IT e Telecomunicações e queremos fazer parte da tua história.




O que precisas para ser um SMARTP Data Analyst?

Conhecimento avançado de SQL e PowerBI
Capacidade para trabalhar em Python é fator de valorização
Experiência a partir de 1 ano
1 a 3 anos de experiência em desenvolvimento de dashboards, KPIs e ETL
Formação em Business Intelligence, Data Analytics ou área similar é fator preferencial




Quais serão as tuas funções na SMART?

Desenvolvimento de dashboards, KPIs e ETL no âmbito de vendas a clientes residenciais
Acompanhamento e otimização de processamento de dados
Identificação de oportunidades de melhoria em todos os indicadores, relatórios e processos
Comunicação e negociação com os canais comerciais, equipas de suporte e outras áreas da empresa
Análises de dados e de negócio




Porquê ser SMART?

Tornamos reais os projetos em que participamos.
Amamos o que fazemos e temos orgulho no resultado do nosso trabalho.
Somos simples e eficientes.
Valorizamos as nossas pessoas.
Somos uma equipa dinâmica, íntegra e de confiança.




Onde podes ser SMART?

Lisboa

Title: Data Analyst Power BI
Description:
Qui sommes-nous ? 🧐




AWAKE Group accélère les innovations responsables et environnementales dans l’industrie. 🌱




AWAKE Group, c’est :

d’un côté INNOVATEAM, acteur de référence du conseil en ingénierie
de l’autre AWAKE, notre expertise dédiée aux projets à forte valeur ajoutée environnementale et responsable, qui se déploie en Belgique et en France. 🇫🇷🇧🇪




En tant qu’ingénieurs, nous contribuons à façonner le monde en participant aux grandes avancées technologiques, en révolutionnant les secteurs suivants :

🚆Smart Mobility ☀️New Energies & Infrastructures 💻Connectivity & Data 🔬Healthcare 🌎Defence & Space




De cette responsabilité en découle une autre 👉 assumer à notre niveau l’impact du progrès sur notre planète et agir pour en limiter les effets indésirables.




AWAKE Group c’est une équipe jeune, dynamique et engagée ! Tes futurs collaborateurs sont super (la preuve : nous sommes accrédités HappyIndex@AtWork depuis 9 années consécutives !) 🤩




INNOVATEAM est à la recherche d'un Data Analyst Power BI (H/F) pour l'un de nos partenaires à Valognes (50).




A propos du poste 🧐




Missions :




Structurer et automatiser les bases de données : Optimisation et mise en place de processus automatisés pour améliorer la gestion des données sous Power BI.
Développer et optimiser les tableaux de bord : Création de visualisations pertinentes pour faciliter l’analyse des données et la prise de décision.
Assurer la fiabilité et la cohérence des données : Vérification des sources, mise en place de contrôles et résolution des anomalies éventuelles.
Collaborer avec les équipes métiers : Compréhension des besoins, définition des indicateurs clés et accompagnement à l’utilisation des outils développés.




Profil recherché :




Formation et Expérience : Bac+3 à Bac+5 avec une spécialisation en analyse de données, BI ou informatique décisionnelle. Première expérience significative en data analysis, idéalement avec Power BI.
Compétences Techniques : Compétences en modélisation, DAX, SQL et structuration de données.




Toutes nos offres sont ouvertes aux personnes en situation de handicap.




Les petits + ✨

En nous rejoignant, tu gagnes plusieurs avantages :

🍃 Rejoindre une société qui compense entièrement ton empreinte carbone #Ingenieur&Citoyen

⚡️Bénéficier de 180 euros par an sur notre plateforme TeamStarter pour créer les afterworks et teambuildings de ton choix

🥇 Une des meilleures mutuelles du marché

💼 Un plan de carrière sur-mesure grâce à votre manager et votre HR Partner

😀 De la bonne humeur et de super events tout au long de l’année !

Show more

Missions :


  • Structurer et automatiser les bases de données : Optimisation et mise en place de processus automatisés pour améliorer la gestion des données sous Power BI.
  • Développer et optimiser les tableaux de bord : Création de visualisations pertinentes pour faciliter l’analyse des données et la prise de décision.
  • Assurer la fiabilité et la cohérence des données : Vérification des sources, mise en place de contrôles et résolution des anomalies éventuelles.
  • Collaborer avec les équipes métiers : Compréhension des besoins, définition des indicateurs clés et accompagnement à l’utilisation des outils développés.


Profil recherché :


  • Formation et Expérience : Bac+3 à Bac+5 avec une spécialisation en analyse de données, BI ou informatique décisionnelle. Première expérience significative en data analysis, idéalement avec Power BI.
  • Compétences Techniques : Compétences en modélisation, DAX, SQL et structuration de données.


Toutes nos offres sont ouvertes aux personnes en situation de handicap.


Les petits + ✨

En nous rejoignant, tu gagnes plusieurs avantages :

🍃 Rejoindre une société qui compense entièrement ton empreinte carbone #Ingenieur&Citoyen

⚡️Bénéficier de 180 euros par an sur notre plateforme TeamStarter pour créer les afterworks et teambuildings de ton choix

🥇 Une des meilleures mutuelles du marché

💼 Un plan de carrière sur-mesure grâce à votre manager et votre HR Partner

😀 De la bonne humeur et de super events tout au long de l’année !

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
As a Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in shaping our data strategy and ensuring the successful implementation of our data initiatives. You will be responsible for analysing complex datasets, providing actionable insights and reports, and contributing to the development of our data platform. Your technical aptitude, curiosity, and autonomy will be essential as you collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive data-driven decision-making.

As we embark on an exciting journey to create a robust data service, establish comprehensive data governance, and develop an innovative data platform!




Key Responsibilities

Analyse large datasets to extract meaningful insights and trends that support business objectives.
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to communicate data findings to stakeholders.
Collaborate with data engineers to design and implement data pipelines and ELT processes.
Participate in the creation and enhancement of our data platform, ensuring it meets the needs of various business units.
Provide technical expertise and support in data modelling, data integration, and data warehousing.
Work closely with stakeholders to understand their data needs and provide solutions that drive business value.




About YOU

More than 3 years of significant experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in a Startup or a software company.
Strong proficiency in data analysis tools and languages (e.g., SQL, Python, R).
Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Qlik, Power BI).
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Ability to work autonomously and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
Curiosity and a passion for leveraging data to drive business outcomes.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
1. Présentation

Datatorii est une société de conseil spécialisée en data.

Partenaires des directions métiers et IT, nous accompagnons nos clients dans la mise en place de solutions techniques Microsoft ainsi que dans l’analyse de leurs données.




La R&D réalisée en interne (10% du temps, au Dojo) autour de la formation continue et du suivi des évolutions technologiques nous positionne comme un partenaire de choix, spécialisé Data Microsoft.




Organisme de formation, nous accompagnons également nos clients de la prise en main jusqu’à la maîtrise des outils et des méthodes autour de la data.




Nichés dans le 1er arrondissement de Paris, nos locaux vous offrent tout le confort pour vous former, échanger régulièrement avec vos pairs, participer aux ateliers internes et recevoir nos clients.




Datatorii vous donne la possibilité de réaliser vos prochains défis !










2. Mission

La communication en entreprise, interne ou externe, est de plus en plus influencée par la restitution de données, que ce soit via des dashboards, des rapports interactifs ou des présentations au Top Management.




Chez Datatorii, vous évoluerez au sein d’un dispositif pluridisciplinaire (Ingénieur, Data Scientist, Architecte, Chef de projet, Formateur, etc.) qui propose des solutions complètes data :




La récolte du besoin auprès des utilisateurs, la définition de personas, de maquettes et d’user-flow
La création de Style Guides Data et de thèmes clé-en-main pour les projets de visualisation de données
L’accompagnement sur les réalisations (PowerBI, PowerApps, Microsoft Azure, Python, SQL, Modélisation, ...)
La conception d’offres innovantes et leur promotion (UX BI, BI Self-service, Low-code application, Data Management ...)
La réalisation de dashboards et rapports interactifs à fort enjeux
La formation interne ou externe au sein de notre organisme de formation




Grâce à nos parcours de carrière gamifiés, nos training kit et notre dispositif d’accompagnement, Datatorii vous intègre dans un parcours certifiant et vous offre toutes les chances de réussir avec des perspectives de carrière claires et stimulantes.







3. Profil

Formation initiale

BAC +5 Ecole de commerce (Data Analyst, Data Business) ou (Ingénieur, mathématiques, statistiques, informatique)




Connaissances ou expériences

Vous possédez une première expérience significative en DataViz
Vous y avez développé des compétences de Business Analyst (DataViz, UX, Modélisation, etc. )




Qualités

Excellent relationnel
Bon communicant
Proactif
Pédagogue
Capacité d’analyse et de synthèse
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At Plum, we're on a mission to maximise wealth for all. We're making saving money effortless and turning investing into something everyone can do.

Our journey began back in 2017, when we became one of the first to use artificial intelligence and automation to simplify personal finance. Fast forward to today, and we've already helped people save £2 billion across 10 European markets.

Named the UK's fastest-growing fintech in the Deloitte Technology Fast 50, our success is down to the passion and dedication of our diverse team. Based in our London, Athens and Nicosia offices, 170 talented people work together to empower people to do more with their money. And now, the team is growing!

About The Role

We are looking for an exceptional Data Analyst to join the team and help expand the value we deliver across Plum.

You will be part of a well established Product Analytics team, consisting of Data Analysts embedded across Product, Marketing and Operations, supporting the companies decision making through data.

What Will You Do


Become domain expert across an area at Plum, establishing yourself as the point of contact for analytical support
Help the teams you work with identify the opportunities (new features, products, bugs etc) they should focus on, by linking these to impact on the metrics of interest
Propose and define success KPIs and guide the teams towards data-driven decision making around these
Work closely with Product Managers, Engineers and Marketeers at Plum to impact size opportunities and estimate the impact these had once released
Produce deep dive analysis that influence the trajectory of the team's roadmap
Data modelling and analysis of key concepts, KPIs and patterns using dbt, BigQuery and SQL
Create interactive and informative dashboards and reports in Looker
Plan, implement, and analyse A/B tests to evaluate the impact of new product features against KPIs
Most importantly, you will have the opportunity to work on a modern Data platform (BigQuery, Looker, dbt), surrounded by an eclectic team of great Data professionals covering areas such as Product Analytics, Data Science and Data & Analytics Engineering



Who You Are


You have strong analytical intuition with a demonstrated ability to solve complex problems and extract actionable insights from data
You demonstrate ability to work independently and with rigour, whilst optimising for impact
You can collaborate effectively within cross-functional teams (Product, Engineering, Design, Marketing), translating business requirements into strong technical solutions
You value attention to detail and know how to balance quality and speed
You are impact driven, love a challenge, and have a self-starter mindset
You're team-oriented, keen to share your knowledge and grow professionally
Previous experience on Fintech, B2C digital businesses and/or fast-paced scale-up environments is very valued



Plum's Perks


We're all in this together! Own part of the company through stock options 💷
Annual training budget
Private Health & Life Insurance
Free Plum Premium subscription (normally £9.99 a month)
Free parking slots
25 days holiday a year, excluding public holidays
Employee referral scheme up to €4000
Flexible approach to remote working, though we encourage at least 2-3 days a week in our beautiful office in central Athens for optimal collaboration
45 days work from anywhere
Team breakfast on Tuesdays and team lunch on Thursdays in the office, as well as a plentiful supply of fruit, snacks and coffee
1 day paid leave for volunteering, supporting you giving back to society
2 weeks paid sabbatical after four years of service
Team trip to secret destinations once a year ✈️
Great office location in the heart of Athens (Syntagma square), with an amazing view!
A vibe that's 🦄🌈💯


If you think this sounds like a bit of you then don't hesitate to get in touch!

Thanks,

Plum Τeam 💜


Plum is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Plum does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need
Show more

Title: Data Analist | PowerBI
HTML:
Ben jij een Data Analist en heb je veel verstand van Data en PowerBI? Wil jij je inzetten voor de Nederlandse vluchtelingensector? Vind jij het leuk om met veel verschillende stakeholders te schakelen en te werken aan een BI Competence Centre? Lees dan snel verder!


Dit ga je doen


Jouw taken als Data Analist bestaan uit:

  • Het zorgdragen voor de juiste implementatie van het BICC;
  • Het in kaart brengen van wensen uit de business;
  • Het meedenken over datamogelijkheden en waar nodig deze vertalen naar beleid en/of actiepunten;
  • Het schakelen met diverse stakeholders;
  • Actief meedenken over verbetermogelijkheden over de data-omgeving.


Hier ga je werken


Deze organisatie in Utrecht, waar jij als Data Analist komt te werken, vormt een onmisbaar onderdeel in de Nederlandse vluchtelingenopvang. Dag in dag uit werken de beste (zorg)professionals samen om vluchtelingen hulp te bieden.


De organisatie is momenteel druk bezig om een Business Intelligence Competence Center (BICC) op te zetten om als interne hub op het gebied van BI te acteren. Dit maakt het voor hen mogelijk om grote hoeveelheden data en processen op de juiste manier te centraliseren en daar de business optimaal te ondersteunen. Hier werken momenteel twee collega's, een kwartiermaker en een externe leverancier aan, maar kunnen hier nog extra ondersteuning in gebruiken.


Als BI Specialist zorg jij dat het BICC op de juiste wijze wordt opgeleverd. Je zorgt voor goede interne en externe communicatie rondom de data-ontwikkelingen. Jij vormt de brug tussen de business en het platform, waardoor je schakelt met stakeholders om wensen in kaart te brengen en deze te vertalen naar concrete BI-oplossingen. Daarnaast denk je actief mee hoe je met behulp van de beschikbare data de business optimaal kan ondersteunen. Samen met de IT Manager en Informatiemanager werk je aan het databeleid voor de komende jaren. Gezien dit een relatief nieuwe rol is, is er veel ruimte voor eigen initiatief en verantwoordelijkheid.


Je vervult een brugfunctie tussen IT en de organisatie en weet precies hoe je met data je doel kan bereiken, hopelijk ook gepaard met een gezonde dosis humor!


Dit doe je uiteraard niet alleen. Je werkt samen in het IT-team dat dagelijks verantwoordelijk is voor de strategie en operatie op IT-vlak en daarnaast kun je altijd terugvallen op je collega's binnen het BI domein.


Ben je enthousiast geworden over deze leuke uitdaging of wil je toch nog wat meer weten? Neem dan gerust telefonisch contact op óf stuur mij een berichtje via Whatsapp.


Dit neem je mee


Als Data Analist neem je tenminste mee:

  • Een achtergrond in Data Analyse of BI Development;
  • Ervaring met het in kaart brengen en verbeteren van processen is een pre;
  • Hbo werk/denkniveau;
  • Affiniteit met de zorg, overheid of de vluchtelingensector;
  • Communicatief vaardig met een pro-actieve houding;
  • Ervaring met stakeholdermanagement tot aan directieniveau.


Dit krijg je


De arbeidsvoorwaarden voor deze functie bestaan onder andere uit:

  • Vakantiegeld;
  • Reiskostenvergoeding;
  • 13e maand;
  • Opleiding- en begeleidingmogelijkheden;
  • Thuiswerkmogelijkheden.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
🏢 About Us



We are a software company developing CRM solutions for the healthcare sector, trusted by top healthcare providers across Spain, Italy, Germany, Poland, Turkey, Brazil, Mexico, and beyond. Since 2019, we have been part of DocPlanner Group, Europe and Latin America's leading healthtech SaaS unicorn, dedicated to transforming healthcare and enhancing the patient experience.



For more about us, visit https://www.tuotempo.es/





Job Description



🎯 The Role



We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team in Barcelona! 🚀
As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role in shaping our product's data strategy, ensuring high-quality data analysis, visualization, and modeling to support data-driven decisions across the company. This position is ideal for someone passionate about data analytics, product insights, and problem-solving in a fast-paced SaaS environment.



🔍 Your Main Tasks & Responsibilities



Data Analysis (40%) – Extract, analyze, and interpret data to generate actionable insights.
Data Visualization (30%) – Build dashboards and reports using Looker, Tableau, or similar tools.
Data Quality (20%) – Ensure accuracy and consistency in data sources.
Data Modeling (10%) – Support business teams with modeling and structuring data for analysis.

You will collaborate closely with Product, DevOps, Backend, and Operations teams, working on 80% project-based tasks and 20% ad-hoc requests.





Qualifications



✨ What Will Make You Shine



🛠 Must-Have Requirements



1-2 years of experience in data analysis within a digital product start-up or SaaS company.
Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field.
Proficiency in SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau).
Strong analytical skills – ability to translate data into insights.
Excellent communication skills – ability to present data clearly and concisely.
Fluent in English (Italian and Spanish are a plus).
Attention to detail – high level of accuracy and commitment to data integrity.

🎯 Nice-to-Have Requirements



Experience with Python or other programming languages.
Familiarity with BigQuery, AWS, or other data warehousing solutions.
Understanding of machine learning techniques and their applications.
Experience in product damanagement, SaaS, or tech industry.
Strong project management and cross-functional collaboration skills.


Additional Information



🚀 Why Join Us?



🌟 What Makes This Role Exciting?



Work on end-to-end data flow, influencing key product and business decisions.
Gain visibility into all company departments, learning from a variety of business areas.
Be part of a fast-growing, international company with a strong tech focus.

📌 Hiring Process



1️⃣ HR Interview – 60 min (in English)
2️⃣ Interview with Hiring Manager – 60 min (in English)
3️⃣ Business Case Assignment (in English)
4️⃣ Team Interview & Business Case Discussion – 60 min (in English)




🌟 Benefits of Working with Us



✅ Dynamic, collaborative work environment
📈 Share options plan after six months
🎂 Extra day off for your birthday
❤️ Comprehensive health insurance
🧠 Access to iFeel - mental wellbeing platform



Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
🚀 ¡Estamos buscando un Data Analyst! 📊💡

🔹 ¿Qué harás en este rol?

📌 Colaborar con partes interesadas para entender necesidades del negocio

📌 Analizar grandes volúmenes de datos no estructurados 📂

📌 Desarrollar consultas avanzadas en SQL para conectar y validar datos 💾

📌 Detectar anomalías y problemas de calidad en los datos ⚠️

📌 Aplicar análisis estadístico y técnicas analíticas para identificar tendencias 📈

📌 Trabajar con equipos de tecnología para desarrollar soluciones automatizadas 🤖

📌 Elaborar reportes y presentaciones claras para la toma de decisiones 📝

📌 Interactuar con todos los niveles dentro de la organización 🏢

🔹 Requisitos obligatorios

✅ Experiencia traduciendo problemas empresariales en soluciones de datos

✅ Conocimiento en métricas clave de servicios financieros 💰

✅ Conocimientos en matemáticas y estadística 📊

✅ Habilidad para identificar oportunidades de uso de datos en diferentes áreas

✅ Fuertes habilidades analíticas, incluyendo:

Resolución de problemas y generación de informes 🔍
Construcción de narrativas basadas en datos 📖
Entendimiento del proceso de gestión del cambio 🔄

🔹 Habilidades deseables

✨ Conocimientos en herramientas innovadoras de gestión de información

✨ Familiaridad con políticas de gobernanza y seguridad de datos 🔐

✨ Experiencia en creación de scripts avanzados (SQL, Python, Impala/Hive/Snowflake).




Sotec an Astek Company es una compañía comprometida con la igualdad de oportunidades, sin tener en cuenta raza, sexo, religión, edad, orientación sexual, estado civil, discapacidad, nacionalidad o identidad de género. Nos sentimos orgullosos de esforzarnos cada día en evitar los sesgos de cualquier tipo







📩 Si te apasiona el análisis de datos y quieres formar parte de un equipo innovador, postúlate ahora! 🚀

Show more
HTML:
🚀 ¡Estamos buscando un Data Analyst! 📊💡

🔹 ¿Qué harás en este rol?

📌 Colaborar con partes interesadas para entender necesidades del negocio

📌 Analizar grandes volúmenes de datos no estructurados 📂

📌 Desarrollar consultas avanzadas en SQL para conectar y validar datos 💾

📌 Detectar anomalías y problemas de calidad en los datos ⚠️

📌 Aplicar análisis estadístico y técnicas analíticas para identificar tendencias 📈

📌 Trabajar con equipos de tecnología para desarrollar soluciones automatizadas 🤖

📌 Elaborar reportes y presentaciones claras para la toma de decisiones 📝

📌 Interactuar con todos los niveles dentro de la organización 🏢

🔹 Requisitos obligatorios

✅ Experiencia traduciendo problemas empresariales en soluciones de datos

✅ Conocimiento en métricas clave de servicios financieros 💰

✅ Conocimientos en matemáticas y estadística 📊

✅ Habilidad para identificar oportunidades de uso de datos en diferentes áreas

✅ Fuertes habilidades analíticas, incluyendo:

  • Resolución de problemas y generación de informes 🔍
  • Construcción de narrativas basadas en datos 📖
  • Entendimiento del proceso de gestión del cambio 🔄

🔹 Habilidades deseables

✨ Conocimientos en herramientas innovadoras de gestión de información

✨ Familiaridad con políticas de gobernanza y seguridad de datos 🔐

✨ Experiencia en creación de scripts avanzados (SQL, Python, Impala/Hive/Snowflake).


Sotec an Astek Company es una compañía comprometida con la igualdad de oportunidades, sin tener en cuenta raza, sexo, religión, edad, orientación sexual, estado civil, discapacidad, nacionalidad o identidad de género. Nos sentimos orgullosos de esforzarnos cada día en evitar los sesgos de cualquier tipo



📩 Si te apasiona el análisis de datos y quieres formar parte de un equipo innovador, postúlate ahora! 🚀

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.
DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for an Data Analyst!




Responsabilities:

Compiling information/preparing reports to support decision-making.
Creating User Stories for the Data Warehouse.
Data modeling in the Data Warehouse.
Collection of adhoc data from commercial and/or analytical systems.




Requirements:

Up to 5 years' experience in the role for which we are contracting the service;
Knowledge of SQL language, Office tools and in particular Excel at an advanced level;
Analytical and communication skills, interpersonal relationships, creativity, initiative and proactivity are the skills we favor.




If you’re interested in this job, please send your CV to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com with reference “CA/DataAnalyst".




Thank You! 😊




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Science Analyst

Competitive salary + 10% bonus + benefits

Milan (2 days per week in the office)




Our client




Our client is a global strategic technology and payments partner. They deliver seamless personalised shopping experiences to over 29m international shoppers, who in turn generate €22.9bn revenue.




With 2,000 employees spread across 50 countries, they integrate with 300,000 point of sale systems in a number of luxury retailers and brands including Harrods, Selfridges, John Lewis, Liberty’s, Apple, Cartier, De Beers, Hermès, Rolex, Dior and Jimmy Choo.




Their products include tax-free shopping, smart data and intelligence, marketing and sales, POS technology and payment solutions.




The role




We’re hiring for a Data Science Analyst to join the Data & Business Intelligence team.




This role will support with the implementation of data science innovation projects that lead to an improvement in customer experience and economic value for the business and its partners.




Reporting to a Data Scientist, this role will support with the scale up and roll out of AI and big data led innovation projects.




As Data Science Analyst, you will:




Develop new Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning based products.
Collect and prepare data for various international projects.
Ensure data quality and consistency pre and post release.
Upgrade advanced analytical models while maintaining business continuity.
Scale analytical solutions from pilot to production for partner brands.
Provide support for advanced analytical solutions.




To apply, you should have




Experience as a Data Analyst or Data Science Analyst with a focus on big data and / or data science projects.
Knowledge of data analysis tools and programming languages such as Python, SQL, and R.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
Strong analytical, problem-solving skills, communication, and English language skills.
Experience working with dislocated teams in a global, multicultural environment.




The perks




Restaurant ticket
Mobile phone (iPhone or Samsung)
Up to 35 days holiday and paid leave per year
Agile working model – ability to work remotely 3 days per week.
Home office IT equipment.
Health insurance (Fondo est).
Pension plan and parental leave




Match Digital specialises in connecting talented individuals with businesses in the digital, tech, media and marcomms industries.

Title: Data Analyst - Grenoble, France (H/F)
Description:
Nos Plus


Astek est green et fait bénéficier ses salariés d’une indemnité kilométrique vélo
Une politique CARE sur-mesure déployée par nos équipes RH pour nos collaborateurs (https://astekgroup.fr/engagements)
Notre charte de la Diversité


Votre Future Équipe


Vous rejoindrez une équipe très sympathique, motivée et dynamique avec de fortes ambitions, qui sera prête à vous intégrer.
Vous bénéficierez d'un accompagnement rapproché et bienveillant.


Votre mission (...si vous l’acceptez !) :

Collecter, analyser et interpréter des données pour aider à la prise de décision Développer et automatiser des tableaux de bord et rapports via Power BI, Tableau ou Python. Optimiser les bases de données et assurer la qualité des données. Collaborer avec les équipes métiers pour identifier des opportunités d’amélioration basées sur les données.

Vous

Diplômé d’une école Ingénieur ou BAC + 5 Expérience en analyse de données, reporting ou data visualization. Maîtrise de SQL, Python, R et d’outils de BI (Power BI, Tableau…). Connaissances en statistiques, modélisation et machine learning (un plus). Bonne communication et capacité à vulgariser les analyses auprès des équipes métiers.

Ce Que Nous Allons Accomplir Ensemble

Vous êtes passionné(e) par la donnée et souhaitez évoluer dans un environnement dynamique et innovant ? Rejoignez Astek en tant que Data Analyst à Grenoble et participez à des projets d’envergure !

Les Petits Plus Du Projet

Un environnement de travail stimulant et une équipe passionnée. Des projets innovants dans divers secteurs d’activité. Un accompagnement pour monter en compétences et évoluer.

Rencontrons-nous !

Vous vous êtes reconnu sur l’annonce et Astek vous plaît ? Postulez directement sur cette annonce, afin que Manon, notre Talent Acquisition Officer, puisse vous contacter pour un premier échange. Maxime, votre futur Manager, vous proposera ensuite d’échanger autour de cette opportunité, de votre parcours et de vos attentes...

,

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
The Story so far: Who we are


Founded in August 2020, Huspy started as a digital mortgage platform and quickly evolved into the largest proptech company in the EMEA region. Backed by leading investors such as Sequoia, Balderton, Founders Fund, and Olayan, we have experienced rapid growth with offices in Dubai, Abu Dhabi, Madrid, and Valencia. Our mission is to revolutionize the real estate industry by building an all-in-one super app designed to empower agents and mortgage brokers.




The Main Event: What you'll do 




Our Data team is at the heart of our decision-making, providing the insights and infrastructure to fuel growth and innovation. Join us to play a vital role in transforming data into actionable intelligence at Huspy!




You’ll join Huspy’s Data team as a Data Analyst with a focus on Business Intelligence, where you’ll support business units by delivering actionable insights and creating impactful reports. Your work will be crucial in helping teams make data-driven decisions, optimize performance, and align with Huspy’s business objectives. You will take ownership of BI tools and dashboards, ensuring data quality and reliability for stakeholders across the organization.




Responsibilities:





Develop and Maintain BI Dashboards: Design, build, and maintain dashboards and reports in Tableau (preferred) or similar BI tools, ensuring they provide clear and actionable insights for business stakeholders.


Data Extraction and Analysis: Use SQL and other data extraction tools to gather, clean, and analyze data from various sources, including Snowflake.


Collaborate with Stakeholders: Work closely with business, product, and engineering teams to understand their data needs, translating business questions into analytical requirements and solutions.


Optimize Reporting: Continuously enhance reporting systems for scalability and efficiency, ensuring reports are easy to access, interpret, and act upon.


Support Data-Driven Decisions: Provide insights and recommendations based on data analysis to support decision-making and performance optimization.


Ensure Data Quality: Implement quality checks and maintain data accuracy across BI systems, working with data engineering to resolve any data issues.


Document BI Processes: Create and maintain documentation for BI processes, data definitions, and dashboard usage guidelines to support consistency and transparency.





The Perfect Match: What you bring





Educational Background: Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Statistics, Data Science, Business Analytics). A Master’s degree is a plus.


Experience: Minimum of 5 years of experience in a data analytics or BI-focused role.


BI and Visualization Expertise: Strong proficiency in BI tools such as Tableau (preferred), Power BI, or Looker, with the ability to create visually compelling and easy-to-navigate dashboards.


Technical Proficiency: Advanced SQL skills for data extraction and manipulation; familiarity with data platforms like Snowflake (preferred) is beneficial.


Data Analysis and Reporting Skills: Experience in conducting data analysis and generating insights to support business needs, including KPI tracking and performance reporting.


ETL Skills: Familiarity with ETL processes for data preparation, ensuring clean, accurate, and well-organized data for analysis.


Attention to Detail: Strong commitment to accuracy, with the ability to identify and correct data discrepancies.


Communication Skills: Ability to communicate complex findings clearly and effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.


Collaborative Spirit: Experience working cross-functionally, especially with product, engineering, and business teams to align data insights with business strategies.





What will set you apart





Experience with Our Tool Stack: Hands-on experience with Tableau, Snowflake, dbt, and Airflow is a strong plus.


Advanced Analytical Knowledge: Proficiency in Python or R for advanced data analysis and modeling.


Experience in Data-Driven Organizations: Previous experience in a fast-paced, data-centric environment where BI plays a strategic role in decision-making.


Business Acumen: Strong understanding of business processes, KPIs, and metrics relevant to the PropTech or startup sector.


Sounds like you? Apply below!
Show more

Title: Data analyst - (Remote - Europe/EU)
Description:
Jobgether has ALL remote jobs globally. We match you to roles where you're most likely to succeed, and provide feedback on every application to help you learn. No more guesswork, application black holes, or recruiter ghosting in your job search.

For one of our clients, we are looking for a Data Analyst (Monochains, Multinetwork, and Cosmos Hub Ecosystem), remotely from Europe.

In this role, you will work with a dynamic and innovative team focused on exploring blockchain ecosystems to identify opportunities and risks. Your responsibilities will involve developing end-to-end data solutions, from initial analysis to deployment, with a strong focus on optimization, scalability, and performance. You'll provide valuable insights to the team and community through informative dashboards, while also improving validation processes and working closely with the data engineering team. This is a fantastic opportunity to shape the future of decentralized finance with cutting-edge technologies.

Accountabilities:


Explore blockchain ecosystems, identifying potential opportunities and risks related to Monochains, Multinetwork, and Cosmos Hub
Design and develop comprehensive data solutions, from analysis to deployment, ensuring performance optimization and scalability
Build and maintain informative dashboards for internal teams, the company, and the wider community
Collaborate with data engineering teams to define data requirements, and ensure proper granularity, frequency, and data quality
Manage and govern team data marts, ensuring data lineage and providing actionable insights
Provide ad-hoc support to team members to address emerging data needs



Requirements


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field
Proficiency in advanced SQL (including joins and window expressions) and experience with Google BigQuery
Competence in analytical programming languages such as Python, with experience in the analytical stack
Experience with ETL tools like Airflow and dbt
Advanced knowledge of data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Superset, Looker)
Strong skills in data research, probability theory, and mathematical statistics, including regressions and A/B testing
Proven ability to tell compelling data stories and present your analysis with clear insights
Familiarity with cryptocurrencies and blockchain technology is a plus
Proficiency in English (B2+ or higher)



Benefits


Competitive salary, with the option to receive payments in cryptocurrency
Well-being program and mental health care support
Compensation for educational programs, including foreign language courses and professional development
Reimbursement for equipment and co-working spaces
Opportunities to attend overseas conferences and engage with the global community
Positive, friendly, and collaborative communication culture
P2P.org is an equal opportunity employer, offering a diverse and inclusive work environment

  • Proficiency in English (B2+ or higher)


Benefits

  • Competitive salary, with the option to receive payments in cryptocurrency
  • Well-being program and mental health care support
  • Compensation for educational programs, including foreign language courses and professional development
  • Reimbursement for equipment and co-working spaces
  • Opportunities to attend overseas conferences and engage with the global community
  • Positive, friendly, and collaborative communication culture
  • P2P.org is an equal opportunity employer, offering a diverse and inclusive work environment

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
What You'll Do:


Minimum 1 year of full-time, analytics-relevant experience
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience
Ability to communicate in English fluently
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to manipulate data sets to identify patterns and insights, and derive actionable strategies
Skilled in data storytelling and crafting impactful presentations for both technical and non-technical audiences
Conceptual and practical understanding of statistics, A/B testing, and experimental design
Proficiency in SQL, Python, and Tableau for automating analyses and creating compelling visualizations
Strong client and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to engage cross-functional teams
Comfortable with ambiguity; able to select the best solution from various analytics techniques
Team player who thrives in a collaborative, inclusive, and learning-forward environment
Proactive, organized and able to effectively prioritize tasks



Who You Are:


Minimum 1 year full-time, analytics-relevant work experience with SQL
Native-level English fluency and strong presentation and public speaking skills, with the ability to present and defend complex analyses to both technical and non-technical audiences
Bachelor’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
Conceptual and practical understanding of statistics and real-world application of statistical concepts particularly in a testing context
Experience with internet advertising technology (tagging, cookies, trafficking) and digital marketing concepts is preferred



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

For employees based in the US, certain roles at Criteo are eligible for additional rewards, including quarterly or annual bonus and restricted stock units. US-based employees receive access to healthcare, dental, and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with company match, short-term and long-term disability coverage, life insurance, family forming and wellness benefits, Flexible Work financial support, learning opportunities, and a robust annual leave plan including volunteer time off and summer vacation days.

The US base salary pay range for this position per year is:

$95,000 - $139,500

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
With more than 90,000 babies born since 1986, Boston IVF is one of the most experienced fertility centers in the world. We proudly offer the most innovative fertility treatments, groundbreaking reproductive technologies – and so much more. We diagnose the most difficult cases. We instill hope. We offer advice and a shoulder to lean on when our patients need it most. Our sole mission is to provide individuals and couples with the best chance for a successful pregnancy – and each day we cherish the bonds we form with our patients.




Boston IVF has a fulltime Data Analyst II position at our Waltham Facility. The Data Analyst II will report directly to the Director of Data Operations.




Responsibilities (including but not limited to):

As a Data Analyst II, you will:

Work across all company applications to maintain and enhance data integrity for both current and historical data
Manage and provide explanations for key metrics and figures displayed in existing Excel reports
Respond to report requests from various departments, ensuring timely and accurate delivery of data
Collaborate with the Director of Data Operations on database programming and scripting
Develop and implement new tools to automate workflows and improve efficiency across the company







Requirements (including but not limited to):

· 3–5 years of experience with Microsoft Excel (required, non-negotiable)

o Strong proficiency with PivotTables and PivotCharts (required, non-negotiable)

o Advanced knowledge of Excel formulas (e.g., VLOOKUP(), INDIRECT(), IFERROR(), etc.) (required, non-negotiable)

o Familiarity with macros/VBA (preferred but not required)

· Strong computer skills—must be tech-savvy with excellent keyboarding skills

· Proficiency in SQL/query languages and understanding of database relationships

· Experience creating detailed reports and explaining key metrics when needed

· Detail-oriented with strong analytical skills

· Bachelor’s degree required

· Strong communication and interpersonal skills—ability to work well in a team







Additional knowledge/skills preferred but not required

· Knowledge/experience in the medical field

· Experience with Filemaker

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Type: Full-Time

Location: Greater Boston (Hybrid or Remote)

 

Who We Are:

At CareConnect, we are transforming the home health care industry with our AI-powered workforce optimization platform. We help organizations streamline hiring, boost engagement, and retain top talent—because when caregivers thrive, so do their patients.




Who We Are Looking For:

Our team seeks an experienced Data Analyst who is passionate about building data products that our customers and internal users love. The ideal candidate is a data enthusiast who thrives on uncovering actionable insights in data, visualizing them with impact, and transforming numbers into narratives.




As a Data Analyst at CareConnect, you’ll work closely with leadership, reporting directly to our SVP of Technology, and will be a key contributor to the organization's growth.

 

What You’ll Do:

Data Gathering & Pipeline: Acquire data from our analytics pipeline, identify gaps, and enhance data coverage.
Data Modeling: Build, maintain, and optimize data models that improve statistical efficiency and quality, provide ongoing updates via reports or dashboards, and make data-driven recommendations to improve.
Data Presenting: Communicate findings by creating compelling visualizations, dashboards, and reports, and present data insights to internal and external stakeholders.
Data Validation: Ensure the quality and accuracy of reported data through repeatable testing (automated preferred) and take ownership of data correctness over the system lifecycle.
Data Interpretation: Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets and understand the connection between success metrics and business results

 

What You Bring:

Strong SQL and relational database expertise.
Deep knowledge of BI platforms (Power BI strongly preferred)
Knowledge of data engineering concepts (data warehousing, data lakes).
Data analysis curiosity and excellent data analytics skills.
Strong grasp of software engineering principles and how they apply to data analytics.
Experience with AI/ML is a plus.




Why Join Us?

Impact: Your insights will directly shape the future of CareConnect and home health care.

Ownership: Own your role – we empower you to take charge and make decisions.

Growth: Work with a high-performing team in a fast-growing company.

 




Interested and qualified candidates, if you’re ready to turn data into action and help revolutionize home health care, we encourage you to apply today!

Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Junior Level (Remote)
Description:
Since 2010 SynergisticIT has helped Jobseekers get employed in the tech Job market by providing candidates the requisite skills, experience and technical competence to outperform at interviews and at clients.

The Tech Job market has been affected by massive layoffs and since 2021 there have been more than 600,000.00 tech layoffs.

The Job market is Hyper Competitive. For 1 position 500-1000 candidates or more are applying and laid off job seekers are also competing for entry level Job positions.

Please see the below links to know more about Synergisticit and some useful tips

Synergisticit Pics /Salaries of Successful Candidates

Synergisticit at Oracle Cloudworld 2023

Synergisticit at Gartner Data & Analytics summit

Why do Tech Companies not Hire recent Computer Science Graduates | SynergisticIT

Technical Skills or Experience? | Which one is important to get a Job? | SynergisticIT

We regularly interact with the Top Tech companies to give our candidates a competitive advantage.

We at Synergisticit understand the problem of the mismatch between employer's requirements and Employee skills and that's why since 2010 we have helped 1000's of candidates get jobs at technology clients like apple, google, Paypal, western union, Client, visa, walmart labs etc to name a few.

We are continuously looking for entry-level software programmers, Java Full stack developers, Python/Java developers, Data analysts/ Data Scientists, Data Engineers, Machine Learning engineers for full time positions with clients.

Who Should Apply? Recent Computer science/Engineering /Mathematics/Statistics or Science Graduates or People looking to switch careers or who have had gaps in employment and looking to make their careers in the Tech Industry.

We need Data Science/Machine learning/Data Analyst and Java Full stack candidates

Preferred SKILLS For Java /Full Stack/Devops Positions

Bachelors degree or Masters degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Information Systems, IT

Knowledge of Core Java , javascript , C++ or software programming

Spring boot, Microservices, Docker, Jenkins, Github, Kubernates and REST API's experience

For data Science/Data Analyst/AI/Machine learning Positions

Preferred SKILLS

Associate or Bachelors degree or Masters degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Information Systems, IT, Statistics, Mathematics or having good logical aptitude

Knowledge of Statistics, Gen AI, LLM, Sagemaker, Python, Computer Vision, data visualization tools

Candidates lacking technical skills can research our other programs which can assist in landing a Job

If you get emails from our Job Placement team and are not interested please email them or ask them to take you off their distribution list and make you unavailable as they share the same database with the client servicing team who only connect with candidates who are matching client requirements.

No phone calls please. Shortlisted candidates would be reached out. No third party or agency candidates or c2c candidates

Title: Sr Data Analyst (remote)
Description:
At Claritev, we pride ourselves on being a dynamic team of innovative professionals. Our purpose is simple - we strive to bend the cost curve in healthcare for all. Our dedication to service excellence extends to all of our stakeholders - internal and external - driving us to consistently exceed expectations. We are intentionally bold, we foster innovation, we nurture accountability, we champion diversity, and empower each other to illuminate our collective potential.

Be part of our amazing transformational journey as we optimize the opportunity towards becoming a leading technology, data, and innovation voice in healthcare. Onward and upward!!!

Job Summary

The Sr. Data Analyst is an individual contributor responsible for defining and building key performance metrics, creating reports and dashboards, and working closely with business stakeholders to track and measure the impact of automated workflows. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure that business processes are optimized and decisions are data-driven.

Job Role And Responsibilities


Define, implement, and maintain metrics, KPIs to measure business performance and the impact of process automation.
Design and implement automation strategies for data collection and reporting to enhance productivity.
Build and maintain interactive dashboards, visualizations, and reports to support business decision-making.
Collaborate with business users and developers to understand workflows and recommend performance improvements.
Analyze data to identify trends, anomalies, and opportunities for optimization.
Work within Agile methodologies to contribute to the lifecycle of performance tracking solutions.
Ensure data quality and consistency across multiple data sources and processes.
Clearly communicate insights, risks, and recommendations to the team and business stakeholders.


,

JOB REQUIREMENTS (Education, Experience, And Training)


5+ years of progressive experience in data analysis, reporting, or business intelligence. Must have strong proficiency in Python for data manipulation. Strong analytical skills are a must!
Ability to work with business stakeholders to understand requirements and define key performance indicators (KPIs).
Proficiency in SQL for querying and analyzing data from relational databases (e.g., SQL Server, Postgres).
Experience with Streamlit, Dash, or other Python frameworks for interactive data presentations.
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
Ability to clean, transform, and model data from multiple sources.
Experience creating automated reports and dashboards.
Strong attention to detail to ensure data accuracy and integrity.
Familiarity with Agile methodologies for iterative delivery.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Finance, or a related field.


Nice To Have


Experience in process mining tools
Experience working with cloud-based databases
Knowledge of NoSQL databases (e.g., MongoDB)


Compensation

The salary range for this position is $110K to $120K. Specific offers take into account a candidate’s education, experience and skills, as well as the candidate’s work location and internal equity. This position is also eligible for health insurance, 401k and bonus opportunity.

Benefits

We realize that our employees are instrumental to our success, and we reward them accordingly with very competitive compensation and benefits packages, an incentive bonus program, as well as recognition and awards programs. Our work environment is friendly and supportive, and we offer flexible schedules whenever possible, as well as a wide range of live and web-based professional development and educational programs to prepare you for advancement opportunities.

Your Benefits Will Include


Medical, dental and vision coverage with low deductible & copay
Life insurance
Short and long-term disability
401(k) + match
Generous Paid Time Off
Paid company holidays
Paid Parental Leave
Tuition reimbursement
Flexible Spending Account
Employee Assistance Program
Summer Hours


EEO STATEMENT

Claritev is an Equal Opportunity Employer and complies with all applicable laws and regulations. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. If you would like more information on your EEO rights under the law, please click here.
